title: How to Be an Organized Artist1
headline: ##STEP##Keep related supplies in the same area.,##STEP##Make an effort to clean a dedicated workspace after every session.,##STEP##Place loose supplies in large, clearly visible containers.,##STEP##Use clotheslines and clips to hang sketches, photos, and reference material.,##STEP##Use every inch of the room for storage, especially vertical space.,##STEP##Use chalkboard paint to make space for drafting ideas right on the walls.,##STEP##Purchase a label maker to make your organization strategy semi-permanent.,##STEP##Make a habit of throwing out old, excess, or useless stuff each month.

title: How to Create a Neopoprealist Art Work
headline: ##STEP##Create a sketch in the NeoPopRealist manner of the future mural on a small piece of paper 8"x10" using the black ink pen.,##STEP##Prepare to create your NeoPopRealist mural.,##STEP##Prepare your paint.,##STEP##Begin your project with a design.,##STEP##Produce a scaled down version of your finished mural.,##STEP##Prepare the wall to be painted.,##STEP##After you have primed the surface, measure the wall.,##STEP##Paint in the base coat of the background.,##STEP##Allow the background and base coats to dry.,##STEP##Draw the lines, then fill the appeared section with different repetitive patterns (examine the images above).,##STEP##Paint patterns with brushes of suitable size for the particular portion of work you are painting.,##STEP##Clean up the lines and shapes as needed.,##STEP##Seal the mural if needed.,##STEP##Be inspired and it will help you succeed!

title: How to Become an Art Investor
headline: ##STEP##Start with some experience or interest in art.,##STEP##Understand the difference between art collectors, art investors and art speculators.,##STEP##Figure out what you are willing to pay for art, before going to an auction house.,##STEP##Pay attention to what schools of art are selling well, and which are down.,##STEP##Focus art investments on fine art paintings, rather than decorative art.,##STEP##Reach out to trusted auction houses and dealers when you are looking to buy art.,##STEP##Buy your investment art when you feel confident of its worth, its price and its ability to grow in value.,##STEP##Study how art is properly stored.,##STEP##Have your art investments appraised occasionally.,##STEP##Consider renting out your art investments.,##STEP##Understand that selling an art investment can take time.

title: How to Be an Organized Artist2
headline: ##STEP##Keep your reference materials, sketches, articles, photos, etc, in one easy to find place.,##STEP##Make "studies," or practice sketches, to organize effectively for larger projects.,##STEP##Limit the supplies you leave out to the project at hand.,##STEP##Keep an updated list of all of the necessary supplies, and the quantities of each.,##STEP##Break down bigger works into more easily completed parts.

title: How to Be an Organized Artist3
headline: ##STEP##Keep all of your past work organized and accessible.,##STEP##Record all of your artistic contacts and connections in one place.,##STEP##Log the costs of supplies needed for each project.,##STEP##Find out how much it costs you to make and sell each piece.,##STEP##Pay attention to what other, similar works of art are selling for.,##STEP##Consider the "cost" of your time when pricing work.

title: How to Train a Parrot
headline: ##STEP##Create a proper training environment.,##STEP##Be prepared.,##STEP##Start early, train often, but don’t push too hard.,##STEP##Have it eating out of your hand.,##STEP##Shape the desired behaviors.,##STEP##Get your clicks.,##STEP##Stay on target.,##STEP##Employ the “step up” as an early training step.,##STEP##Test the most basic method.,##STEP##Use an alternate treat-based step-up.,##STEP##Move on to the target-training step-up.,##STEP##Don’t presume your parrot will (or won’t) talk.,##STEP##Watch your mouth.,##STEP##Start young and stay calm.,##STEP##Repeat, and repeat again.

title: How to Train a Parrot to Say Something
headline: ##STEP##Decide what you want your parrot to say, but make it basic.,##STEP##If you want, you can make it say simple but funny things.,##STEP##You should go to a nice and quiet room.,##STEP##To start teaching it, repeat what you want it to say many times.,##STEP##If you DO get your parrot to say it correctly, then you've succeeded!

headline: ##STEP##Observe your bird's natural behavior.,##STEP##Choose a command.,##STEP##Create a potty spot.,##STEP##Move your bird to the potty spot when he needs to go.,##STEP##Say your command when your bird defecates.,##STEP##Reward the behavior.,##STEP##Take your bird to the potty spot as often as necessary.,##STEP##Do not train a new bird too early.,##STEP##Keep your expectations realistic.,##STEP##Do not scold or hit your parrot.

title: How to Make a Beekeeping Suit
headline: ##STEP##Choose a white button-down shirt.,##STEP##Gather other supplies.,##STEP##Remove the buttons from the shirt.,##STEP##Sew the button holes closed.,##STEP##Cut velcro to line the shirt opening.,##STEP##Attach the velcro to the shirt opening.,##STEP##Cut and attach velcro around the collar and sleeves.,##STEP##Choose a wide-brimmed hat.,##STEP##Gather supplies to make the veil.,##STEP##Measure and cut the fabric.,##STEP##Bring the edges together and sew the seam.,##STEP##Sew the veil to the brim of the hat.,##STEP##Buy the remaining beekeeping suit essentials.,##STEP##Put on the hat and gloves.,##STEP##Put on the shirt.,##STEP##Tuck the shirt into your pants.,##STEP##Put on your socks and shoes.,##STEP##Purchase a light-colored, long-sleeved coverall.,##STEP##Attach elastic to the neck hole and wrists.,##STEP##Put on your suit.

title: How to Identify a Queen Bee
headline: ##STEP##Look for a bee larger than the others in the hive.,##STEP##Look for a bee with a pointed abdomen.,##STEP##Using a magnifying glass, look for a bee without a barb on its stinger.,##STEP##Look for a bee that stands with its legs splayed apart.,##STEP##Watch the way the other bees act subserviently around her.

title: How to Identify the Symptoms of Colony Collapse Disorder
headline: ##STEP##Look for a major or complete desertion of the colony by all adult bees over a short period of time.,##STEP##Look for bees.,##STEP##Check for the queen.,##STEP##Check for another colony moving in.

title: How to Shoe a Horse
headline: ##STEP##Lift the horse's foot.,##STEP##Remove any shoes that are already on the horse's feet.,##STEP##Clean the bottom of the hoof.,##STEP##Use a hoof knife to remove excess, flaky sole from the bottom of the hoof.,##STEP##Trim excess hoof wall with hoof nippers.,##STEP##Use a rasp to flatten and level the the sole.,##STEP##Size the shoe to its hoof.,##STEP##Make minor adjustments to the shape of the shoe, if needed.,##STEP##Secure the shoe in its place with nails.,##STEP##Bend and remove the nail tips.,##STEP##Clinch the nail.,##STEP##File any rough spots on the hoof wall.,##STEP##Repeat process three more times until all four hooves have been shod.

title: How to Get Started Beekeeping
headline: ##STEP##Consider your yard size.,##STEP##Check local laws.,##STEP##Start in the spring.,##STEP##Purchase your hive.,##STEP##Construct a hive stand.,##STEP##Get hive tools.,##STEP##Figure out your bee source early.,##STEP##Purchase a “nuc.” Ask your supplier to provide you with a “nuc.” This is a queen bee and a bunch of workers that are ready to place in the hive once spring starts.If this isn’t an option, buy a confirmed queen bee and about 10,000 individual workers, which equals about three pounds of bees.,##STEP##Introduce your bees to their hive.,##STEP##Feed your bees as necessary.,##STEP##Monitor the hive.,##STEP##Watch for potential problems.

title: How to Transport a Guinea Pig
headline: ##STEP##Get a small-ish guinea pig cage that will fit in the backseat of your car.,##STEP##Fill it with a thick layer of newspaper or a waterproof sheet and cover with a soft fleece or towel bedding.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Place an attachable ceramic bowl in the cage and fill it with your guinea pig's favorite food before hooking it to the cage.,##STEP##Hook up a water bottle and fill it up to the brim.,##STEP##Put a few handfuls of hay into the cage.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Give your guinea pig a toy or two as long as they are light and small - you don't want them to slide and hit your guinea pigs.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Put some veggies your guinea pigs like into the cage.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Put your guinea pigs in to the cage and put the cage in the car on a seat with the seat belt done up.,##STEP##Talk to your guinea pigs whenever you get the chance.,##STEP##Try to pull pull over at a rest stop every hour.,##STEP##When you have reached your destination, move your guinea pig into a proper hutch or cage, away from direct sunlight.

title: How to Clean a Saddle
headline: ##STEP##Soak a sponge in a bucket of warm water.,##STEP##Wring out the sponge till damp and wipe your saddle and tack(this opens the pores of the leather in the saddle to thoroughly clean and condition your tack when saddle/leather soap is applied.),##STEP##Rub the sponge onto some saddle soap to get it nice and sudsy.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Work in the soap into the leather from top to bottom,underneath and everywhere in-between.This may take some elbow grease and you might get a sore hand but the finished result is a nice supple saddle fit for a show.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Use a dry rag to wipe ALL the suds off the saddle.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Still some hard pressed dirt in there?,##STEP##Since you're already covered in suds and want your saddle to look brand new, why not shine it up a bit.,##STEP##You can usually wipe all non-leather parts of a saddle with a damp cloth, or sometimes use a carpet cleaner.##STEP####STEP##

title: How to Saddle a Horse Western
headline: ##STEP##Groom your horse.,##STEP##Check your gear.,##STEP##Set the saddle pad on your horse.,##STEP##Grab the cinches, straps, and stirrups.,##STEP##Lift the saddle onto your horse.,##STEP##Lower the cinches and stirrups.,##STEP##Make the horse put his front hoof forward to avoid causing sores in the girth area on your horse where there are wrinkles in the horse's skin.,##STEP##Tighten the back cinch.,##STEP##Attach the breast collar (if you use one).,##STEP##Pull out any skin that may have gotten trapped under the cinches.,##STEP##Untie your horse.,##STEP##Remember to mount from your horse's left side.

title: How to Put a Saddle On1
headline: ##STEP##Note that saddling normally mainly takes place on the left side of the horse.,##STEP##Have the saddle pad and saddle ready.,##STEP##Place the saddle pad on the horse's back so that the straps on the side are inline with the back of the horses shoulder.,##STEP##Check from the front of the horse that the saddle pad is even on both sides of the horse.,##STEP##Gently lay the saddle on top of the saddle pad evenly.,##STEP##Get the girth and feed the non stretchy side through the straps on the right side of the horse and attach it to the first billet hole.,##STEP##On the other side of the horse, pick up the girth and attach it to the first billet hole on that side as well.,Check and make sure the girth is not pinching the horse anywhere.,Adjust your stirrups to the right length before riding.

title: How to Untack a Horse
headline: ##STEP##Tie up the horse.,##STEP##Move the reins up to the horse's poll.,##STEP##Undo the curb chain, if the bridle has one, by unhooking it from the left side of the bridle.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Undo the throatlatch.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Undo the cavesson, or 'nose band.',##STEP##Take hold of the reins, as well as the bridle between the horses ears and pull it gently over the ears, letting the horse drop the bit from its mouth so you don't bang his teeth.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Put the bridle and reins over your shoulder, and place a halter on your horse.,##STEP##Once he is tied safely, stand on the left side of the horse, lift up the saddle flap and unbuckle the girth.,##STEP##Place your arms under the front and back of the saddle (and saddle pad, if the horse is wearing one) and lift the saddle off the horses back.,##STEP##Hang up all your tack.##STEP####STEP##

title: How to Put a Saddle On2
headline: ##STEP##Note that saddling normally mainly takes place on the left side of the horse.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Have the saddle pad and saddle ready.,##STEP##Place the saddle pad on the horse's back.,##STEP##Check from the front of the horse that the saddle pad is even on both sides of the horse.,##STEP##Before putting the saddle on the horse, hook the stirrup on the opposite side of where you are standing up over the saddle horn so it doesn't get caught under the saddle when you put it on the horse.,##STEP##Lay the saddle on top of the saddle pad evenly.,Put the stirrups and cinch down to hang at the horse's sides.,Make the horse put it's front leg, on the side you are cinching the saddle on, forward to avoid pinching the skin when you tighten the cinch.,##STEP##If your saddle has a back cinch, tighten the front cinch first and then tighten the back one.,Check and make sure the girth is not pinching the horse anywhere.

title: How to Put on an English Saddle Properly
headline: ##STEP##Groom your horse.,##STEP##Run up the stirrup irons on the stirrup leathers.,##STEP##Detach the girth and set it aside.,##STEP##Make sure the pad is lined up properly with the edges of the saddle.,##STEP##Stand on the left-hand (near) side of the horse, place the saddle and pad on the horse's back with the pommel of the saddle just in front of the horse's withers.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Slide the saddle back (in the direction of the hair growth) until it settles into place.,##STEP##Attach the girth to the girth straps on the off side (the horse's right), then bring it up to the near side (the horse's left).,##STEP##Fasten the girth securely - you should be able to get your hand between horse and girth, but it should be a snug fit.,##STEP##Drop your stirrups before you mount.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Mount and recheck your girth to see if it needs tightening.

title: How to Tell if a Girl Likes You over Text
headline: ##STEP##Pay attention to how often she starts the conversation.If initiating the conversation always falls on your shoulders, odds are, she is not very interested.,##STEP##See if she is usually the first to say goodbye.,##STEP##Count the emoticons.,##STEP##Determine how interested she is in what you have to say by her replies.If she has good, thorough responses to your comments, it shows a higher degree of interest in your thoughts and, by extension, a higher interest in you.,##STEP##Be encouraged if she starts to tease you.Texts like, "You should be wishing you were here right now..." or "If you were here right now..." are usually meant to tease you into wondering what the rest of the sentence would read, especially when they end with the "..." They are mildly suggestive without being too over the top, implying that she wants to get you to think about her and wonder about her feelings and intentions a little more.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Note the content of her messages.,##STEP##Pay attention to punctuation.,##STEP##Look at how many of her words are unnecessarily long.,##STEP##Watch out for text giggles.,##STEP##Ask yourself if she frequently drops any hints.

headline: ##STEP##Walk past him a few times during the day, without 'noticing' him.,##STEP##Smile at him once in a while, like when you walk past him or see him looking at you. ##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Say "Hi" to him in the mornings.,##STEP##'Accidentally' walk into him or cross his path and nearly hit him, after pretending to be distracted by something else. ##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Look at him and then away quickly.,##STEP##Spend time where he does, but not obsessively.,##STEP##Strike up a conversation with him about something like how much homework he is receiving.,##STEP##Flirt a little with him, like, if he told you a funny joke, giggle cutely.,##STEP##Try the distracted method.,##STEP##Be a little mysterious- don't blab everything about yourself to him in the first few conversations. ##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##If he teases you, he may like you back.,##STEP##If you think he does like you back, ask him out to a movie or lunch.,##STEP##Be different.,##STEP##Use the natural assets you have and flatter them by wearing clothes or styling your hair in a way that suits you.,##STEP##Laugh and smile a lot when he is near or if you are talking to him.,##STEP##If he compliments you and you really like him, chances are you are going to blush and smile shyly.,##STEP##Ask his friends about him openly- it will show them that you like him, and they will probably blab to him about it later.,##STEP##Be friendly and open to him.,##STEP##Do something 'absentmindedly' around him- like, if you are reading, twirl your hair or drum your fingers lightly on your seat or play with your necklace/earrings. ##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##BE YOURSELF.

headline: ##STEP##Before starting a conversation with him, smile when he looks at you whenever you happen to lock eyes.,##STEP##If he doesn't start a conversation with you after smiling, YOU start the talking.,##STEP##Just greet him and introduce yourself, but remember to be enthusiastic and very friendly towards him.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Ask about classes you both share or your opinion on teachers when confronting him.,##STEP##Remember to smile!,##STEP##Just be yourself!,##STEP##Act as if he is just one of your regular friends that you know.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Don't put on tons of make-up to try to impress him.,##STEP##Look presentable!,##STEP##Don't talk about other guys when talking.,##STEP##Have fun!,##STEP##If you find out he's not interested in you, don't sweat it.

headline: ##STEP##Figure out how you look when you're around your crush and you could even ask some friends how you are whenever you're around him.,##STEP##Know and remember if your crush sees you like that, he may know you like him.,##STEP##Whenever you approach your crush, whether you bump into him at a store, at school with friends or by yourself, or just anywhere, stay and remain calm and focus your attention on something else.,##STEP##If you think about your crush a lot and maybe even daydream about him, slowly start thinking of your crush less and less everyday, so that when you see him, it won't be as big of a deal.,##STEP##Once you've gotten over your shyness or feel more comfortable around your crush, stay POSITIVE.,##STEP##Have your friends make you feel better and help you with your crush (Especially the ones you trust).,##STEP##Find something you have in common with him and if it is an activity, ask them how it is going.,##STEP##Pretend that he is just a normal dude.

title: How to Attract an Older Boy
headline: ##STEP##Ask yourself why you want an older boyfriend.,##STEP##Make sure you want a relationship for the right reasons.A relationship should be pursued because you feel a legitimate connection with the other person.,##STEP##Consider how an age gap might affect a relationship.,##STEP##Prepare yourself for criticism.If there is a significant age gap between you and the guy you're with, there are a number of problems you should prepare to deal with that you wouldn't normally have to think about.,##STEP##Be his friend first.,##STEP##Let him take the lead.,##STEP##Treat him as an equal.,##STEP##Hold his gaze.Eye contact is a very powerful part of body language, and it's especially important in terms of flirting.,##STEP##Smile at him.Smiling is a universal language for warm feelings and affection.,##STEP##Offer compliments.,##STEP##Make sure he respects your boundaries.,##STEP##Start hanging out with older people.,##STEP##Follow through with whatever you say you're going to do.Reliability is a hallmark of any truly mature person.,##STEP##Be proud of who you are.,##STEP##Keep a journal.Keeping track of your daily thoughts and feelings in a journal is a great path to self-discovery.,##STEP##Get past jealousy.,##STEP##Avoid social cliques and drama.,##STEP##Try a new hairstyle.,##STEP##Dress to suit his age range's fashion sense.,##STEP##Keep your makeup light.,##STEP##Keep your posture confident.Regardless of your gender or age, posture is an important way of expressing confidence and making yourself look attractive to anyone around you.

headline: ##STEP##Communicate with your eyes.,##STEP##Raise your eyebrows just the tiniest bit whenever he smiles, nods, winks, etc.,##STEP##Look down and flutter your eyelashes a little.,##STEP##Push your tongue against the skin below your bottom teeth.,##STEP##When your eyes meet with his, move your shoulder forward slightly and then let it drop.,##STEP##Once you've glanced at him quickly, look away and continue on with whatever you were doing.,##STEP##Get close.,##STEP##Involve your hair.,##STEP##Remember to be yourself.

headline: ##STEP##Be yourself.,##STEP##Ask her about herself.,##STEP##Ask her a simple question.,##STEP##She'll start random conversations with you.,##STEP##If she walks by you and doesn't look at you or acknowledge you, it may be because she wants you to think she isn't interested.,##STEP##Does she pay attention to you?,##STEP##Say something random to her.,##STEP##Make sure to be nice to her.,##STEP##If her friends look at her and then you, or whenever you are talking to her, her friends give looks at you and raise their eyebrows, this is also a good sign, and if somebody says she tease her.,##STEP##Don't talk to her best friend obsessively, as this could hint that maybe you like her best friend and that is not a good sign!,##STEP##When you're in the hallway, try to walk a couple of steps in front of her.,##STEP##If you talk to her in class and she's quiet and quick speaking, but you talk to her on the phone or something and she's all loud and not nervous, she may like you.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Notice when she sits by you in class.,##STEP##Get up a few times in class.,##STEP##If she looks at you and doesn't say anything, then she is waiting for you to say something to start the conversation or give a simple sign to let her know that you notice her, like a wave and smile.,##STEP##If you both have Facebook accounts or something similar and she starts chatting with you within five minutes of your arrival online, and this happens a few times, this is a good sign.,##STEP##If you have known her for a long time, then if she likes you, she will start to change her behavior, unconsciously or consciously.,##STEP##If you are friends and she goes to you with all her problems, it shows she trusts you and wants you to be part of her life.,##STEP##If you play an online game and she is your friend on the game, she might start sending you a lot of presents.,##STEP##If you make her laugh and she puts her head on your shoulder and puts her hand over yours there is a good chance she likes you.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##If she is slouching forward with her head in her arms, or her hair is concealing her face, pay attention to which way her chair angles, and which way her face is pointing.,##STEP##If you are in lunch and she stares at you from time to time maybe smiling from here to there, she is probably into you.,##STEP##Check to see if she's flirting.,##STEP##Note!,##STEP##Tease her a little, but not too much.,##STEP##Get to know her very well then ask her out but don't say, "Do you like me?",##STEP##Help her out and do stuff with her!,##STEP##She stares at you.,##STEP##If you like her, but you're not sure if she likes you back, go to one of her best friends and have them ask her who she likes.

title: How to Tell a Girl You Like Her
headline: ##STEP##Get to know her as a friend before "making a move.",##STEP##Build a relationship off of common interests, finding common interests to bring your together as a couple.,##STEP##Keep clean and well dressed to both look and feel confident.,##STEP##Smile, keep your head up, and pull your shoulders back to exude confidence.,##STEP##Stay calm, even if you're nervous, by slowly counting to three in your head before talking or responding.,##STEP##Think about what you want to say ahead of time, but keep it brief.,##STEP##Wait to tell her until the two of you are alone and she is in a good, stress-free mood.,##STEP##Talk to her in person instead of through text, the internet, or a phone call.,##STEP##Know that an open, honest discussion is far more important than any big surprise.,##STEP##Look at her in the eyes.,##STEP##Just come out and say it!,##STEP##Let her respond on her own instead of asking for a response.,##STEP##Have a game plan.,##STEP##Flirt with her through eye-contact, light touching, and smiles.,##STEP##Don't try to rush through things.,##STEP##Continue building the relationship as friends first, and a couple second.,##STEP##Know that you did everything in your power, and be proud of your courage.,##STEP##Understand that arguing or getting angry fixes nothing in this situation.,##STEP##Give her some space for a few weeks.,##STEP##Be open to other opportunities.

title: How to Tell Someone You Have Feelings for Them
headline: ##STEP##Figure out your own feelings first.It's important to first ask yourself whether your feelings are really strong enough to warrant taking things to the next level.,##STEP##Consider your chances.,##STEP##Find out if your crush is already interested in somebody else.,##STEP##Check your crush for signs of attraction.Signs of attraction, whether conscious or unconscious, will usually shine through in a given interaction, even if it's just a friendship on the surface level so far.,##STEP##Make sure there are no outstanding issues in your current friendship.,##STEP##Make sure your lives are relatively stable.,##STEP##Dress your best.,##STEP##Use confident body language.Confident body language is a positive vicious cycle.,##STEP##Make a list of reasons why you would be great for your crush.,##STEP##Stay calm and upbeat.,##STEP##Ask your crush to meet up with you.,##STEP##Hang out casually.,##STEP##Make eye contact.Exhibiting all forms of positive, confident body language is an important trick when it comes to attracting someone, but nothing's quite as important as holding eye contact while you admit romantic feelings to your crush.,##STEP##Tell your crush how you feel.,##STEP##Express your feelings non-verbally.,##STEP##Express your intentions.,##STEP##Let your crush respond.,##STEP##Work damage control, if necessary.

headline: ##STEP##A week before the prom/dance, purchase a dress that both fits you and complements your body shape.,##STEP##Shop for a pair of cute shoes if you need one.,##STEP##About a few hours before the prom/dance, it's best to prepare so that you won't be late.,##STEP##Pick out any accessories that match your dress, but beware of having too many.,##STEP##Look up prom hairstyles and choose one that appeals to you.,##STEP##Apply your makeup as needed.,##STEP##Apply deodorant to make sure you smell good.,##STEP##Slip into your shoes and pop on a jacket if needed, making sure not to mess up your hairstyle or wrinkle your dress.,##STEP##Hold yourself in a tall position by throwing back your shoulders the slightest bit and sucking in your stomach a little.,##STEP##Meet your crush and give him a friendly, "Hey.",##STEP##Don't be afraid to dance with your crush, but remember that you don't have to dance to every single song that is playing.,##STEP##Smile naturally, as this is one of the important keys to unlocking your beauty.,##STEP##If you're lucky, you two might kiss or become a couple.

headline: ##STEP##Wait for the right time and place to start a conversation.,##STEP##Talk to your crush like you already know him or her.,##STEP##Think about what he or she might be interested in talking about.,##STEP##Freshen your breath before you talk.,##STEP##Make a funny or playful comment about the place you are at or thing you are doing.,##STEP##Get the update on something he or she has been doing, especially if you share something in common.,##STEP##Ask for his or her opinion on something easy to talk about.,##STEP##Ask him or her something unexpected but easy to answer.,##STEP##Go with an opening line that pops in your head.,##STEP##Ask questions about his or her interests, hobbies, or work.,##STEP##Be an active listener in your conversation.,##STEP##Show him or her that you are enjoying yourself in conversation.,##STEP##Make a plan to hang out again, and/or get his or her number.If things seem to be going well, ask your crush if he or she wants to hang out again or ask for his or her number.,##STEP##Bring the conversation back to something you already talked about.,##STEP##End the conversation on a good note.

title: How to Meet a Girl on a Vacation1
headline: ##STEP##Consider the place you're going to vacation at.It goes without saying that some vacation destinations are better than others when it comes to meeting women.,##STEP##Go on a singles cruise.Although most cruises are intended for married couple, there are specific cruises that capitalize on offering experiences for singles.,##STEP##Look into singles vacation packages.Although the tourism industry is conventionally built around couples, families and groups, there are vacation packages catered specifically to singles as well.,##STEP##Plan your vacation activities with meeting women in mind.,##STEP##Go vacationing with the right kind of people.The people you go on vacation with will have a major impact on your experience abroad.

title: How to Meet a Girl on a Vacation2
headline: ##STEP##Sharpen up your social skills in the months prior.,##STEP##Dress appropriately.Looking good is an important part of meeting and attracting women no matter where you are.,##STEP##Stay busy.,##STEP##Act friendly.Above all, it doesn't hurt your chances to be sincerely friendly towards people while you're out on vacation.,##STEP##Carry something to share with others.If you carry something as simple as a pack of smokes or playing cards, you'll have a physical proper conversations with.

title: How to Meet a Girl on a Vacation3
headline: ##STEP##Keep the conversation light-hearted.Even if you're looking to make a serious romance with the girl you're talking with, you shouldn't touch upon any serious topics when you're first chatting with her.,##STEP##Invite her to do something with you.You shouldn't wait long into a conversation before asking the girl to do something fun with you.,##STEP##Take advantage of a vacation's excitement.Unlike a romance closer to home, there's a much greater degree of excitement when you're out on vacation.,##STEP##Share good experiences together.A vacation is meant to be a time where you get out and do things you're not familiar with.,##STEP##Look for signs of attraction.As with any interaction with a woman you're interested in, you can gauge the likelihood of your success by looking at signs of attraction.,##STEP##Act quickly.Vacations don't last long, so your window of opportunity will almost always be accordingly brief.,##STEP##Practice safety first.Vacationers who meet other singles are more likely to practice unsafe sexual practices than if they were back at home.

title: How to Meet a Girl on a Vacation4
headline: ##STEP##Decide what you want.,##STEP##Look up the girl online.Looking up the girl's name on social media will give you a glimpse into her regular life.,##STEP##Be realistic.Romances while out on vacation can be a lot of fun, but the truth is that the vast majority of them do not last for very long.,##STEP##Make plans to stay in touch.,##STEP##Accept the potential for rejection.,##STEP##Reflect on the experience.Most romances while on vacation don't end up amounting to anything long-lasting.

title: How to Talk to Your Crush Via Email
headline: ##STEP##Find out your crush's email.,##STEP##Don't sound like you're saying something smart (like a know-it-all).,##STEP##If your crush keeps emailing, score!,##STEP##If you are smarter than your crush, make no comments that are sarcastic, confusing or unanswerable.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##If you begin talking everyday and he or she hasn't emailed you yet that day ... be brave, just email, "Hi" or "Hey," and they should continue the conversation from there.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Never get too clingy, always expecting an email.,##STEP##If you tell them you like them via email make sure they like you back.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##If they tell you they like you via email, do not be scared, simply email back with "I like you," but only if you do, or say "Thanks, but we're just friends," and wait for the next email.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##If you are receiving emails from your crush within 3-5 minutes of sending them, they are hooked, so just keep going.##STEP####STEP##

title: How to Muck Out a Stall
headline: ##STEP##Remove the hay, water bucket and manger to avoid contamination and keep the stall clean.,##STEP##Remove all the bigger, more obvious droppings on the surface with the shavings fork or rubber glove.,##STEP##When you have done this, toss the shavings to the sides of the stall, removing any droppings that fall out of them as you do so.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Scoop up the wet shavings with the shavings fork.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Sweep the floor and shovel up any remaining manure.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##If possible, leave the floor to dry and air for a while before pulling back the shavings to lay the bed.,##STEP##If necessary, add new shavings.,##STEP##Use the four-pronged pitchfork to loosen them and dump them into the stall.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Spread the shavings around to make a comfortable stall.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Replace the water and feed bowls.,##STEP##Sweep the yard if necessary and put the tools back neatly.

headline: ##STEP####STEP##Find all the tools that are lying around, collect them and put them in a proper, safe place.##STEP##,##STEP##Learn how to store them correctly, such as with forks, if you lay them against a wall, the prongs must face towards the wall.,Clean all bits of bailing twine, empty feed sacks, and other rubbish away.,Sweep the corridor or courtyard completely to check for any other hazards.

title: How to Start a Relationship from Dating a Stranger
headline: ##STEP##You can meet someone anywhere.,##STEP##Walk up to the person you are interested in and talk about random things.,##STEP##Build a rapport by flirting a bit...don't go too far.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Sometime during the conversation, exchange names.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Continue flirting.,##STEP##Assess whether closing in for their phone number would be ideal.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##If ideal, go ahead and see if you can their phone number; ex: Is she flirting back?,##STEP##Ask for the number by saying something like: "It was nice meeting you, unfortunately I have to go, but I would really like to continue this conversation.,##STEP##Proceed to pull out your cellphone, enter her phone number.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Call it so she has yours.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Say good-bye and leave.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Wait for a day.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Call.,##STEP##Dress accordingly and flirt by talking less and asking more questions.,##STEP##Call again at your discretion.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Suggest a private meeting next time, such as your place for a movie.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Build more rapport by asking about topics such as her dreams and childhood, talk about how she is unique, look mesmerized and then slowly work into a kiss.,##STEP##Repeat steps 13 through 15 and then after a few weeks, ask her out on an "official" date.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Congratulations!,##STEP##At this time you may also want to hang out apart from just organized dates (for the sake of hanging out, like with your guy buddies.),##STEP##Have a serious discussion on whether you guys should be in a relationship.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##The relationship has either started or you're still casually dating.

title: How to Feed Guinea Pigs Vitamin C1
headline: ##STEP##Don’t rely on hay and grass alone.,##STEP##Choose a guinea pig food pellet that includes Vitamin C. Premium foods designed for guinea pigs will include Vitamin C, which is added during the manufacturing process.Don’t store the food pellets for more than a month.Vitamin C degrades over time.,##STEP##Add leafy greens to your guinea pig’s diet.,##STEP##Feed fruits and other vegetables to your guinea pig for a treat.Peppers, guava, broccoli, cauliflower, strawberry, peas, tomatoes, and kiwi are good sources of Vitamin C for guinea pigs.,##STEP##Never give your guinea pig poisonous foods.

title: How to Feed Guinea Pigs Vitamin C2
headline: ##STEP##Feed specially designed Vitamin C tablets directly to your guinea pig.,##STEP##Offer Vitamin C tablets or liquids designed for children.Be sure not to give too much.,##STEP##Don’t rely on adding Vitamin C to drinking water.Supplements may alter the taste of the water and discourage your guinea pig from drinking enough, leading to dehydration as well as Vitamin C deficiency.

title: How to Feed Guinea Pigs Vitamin C3
headline: ##STEP##Recognize a guinea pig suffering from insufficient Vitamin C. An insufficiency can produce symptoms within two weeks.Common symptoms include: , poor appetite and weight loss##STEP##bleeding gums and pain the teeth##STEP##stiff joints##STEP##nasal discharge##STEP##rough texture to the hair##STEP##difficulty avoiding infections or healing from wounds##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Consult your vet.,##STEP##Use a dropper or syringe to get Vitamin C into a sick guinea pig.

headline: ##STEP##Make sure your guinea pig is getting enough vitamin-C.,##STEP##Avoid giving guinea pigs foods that are bad for them.,##STEP##Avoid commercial guinea pig treats.,##STEP##Feed a balanced diet, instead of supplementing with multivitamins or salt wheels.,##STEP##Control the amount of food you give your guinea pig.,##STEP##Serve food in ceramic dishes.,##STEP##Keep food fresh.,##STEP##Adjust food quantities if the guinea pig becomes underweight or overweight.The amount of food a guinea pig will need depends on its age, its lifestyle, and its general health.,##STEP##Provide fresh water at all times.Place a water bottle in your guinea pig's cage, so that it can access clean water at any time.,##STEP##Let your guinea pig graze occasionally.

title: How to Make a Lead Rope for Your Horse
headline: ##STEP##Choose your rope.,##STEP##Decide what length you want the finished lead line to be.,##STEP##Cut your rope to the right length.,##STEP##Start the braiding##STEP####STEP##In order to start making your lead line, tie the ends on one side together, to keep the braiding from falling apart.,##STEP##Secure your braiding by making a simple knot with your pieces.,##STEP##Take some thin rope and wrap it around the three ends.,Continue this until you reach the end of your lead line.,When you are finished, tie a couple of knots at one spot and cut your thin rope.,Glue the ends of the thin rope to the braiding to secure them.,##STEP##Fold the other end of your lead line in half to create a loop.,Make a couple of knots with the ends of the rope going around the base of the loop to secure it.,##STEP##Take some thin rope and wrap it around the three ends.,Continue wrapping until you reach the end of your three ends.,When you are finished tie a couple of knots at one spot and cut your rope.,Glue the ends of the thin rope to the braiding to secure them,##STEP##Use your rope.

title: How to Make a Wood Saddle Rack
headline: ##STEP##Measure the length of the saddle for which you are making the rack.,##STEP##Using 2"x12" boards, cut two boards the length of the saddle for the top.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Cut two more boards for the height of the rack you would like to make it.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Cut these two boards on one end at about 30 degrees to angle the top boards so that the saddle may rest comfortably.,##STEP##Nail or screw these two standing boards to the top two boards.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Cut a board using the length of the saddle minus twice the width of the board for the center support.,##STEP##Nail or screw the support board between the two standing boards.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Cut two more boards the width of the saddle rack.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Nail or screw these two boards on the bottom of the standing boards.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Stand the rack upright.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Rest your saddle blanket on the stand.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Rest your saddle on the blanket.##STEP####STEP##

headline: ##STEP##Check that the halter (head collar) size fits the size of your pony's head.,##STEP##Stand to the left side of your pony.,##STEP##Allow the pony to sniff your hands as well as the halter.,##STEP##Put a lead rope over the the pony's neck so that should he start to wander off before the halter is on, you can hold him back.,##STEP##Start with the halter ready to be put on the horse.,##STEP##Hold the nose band in one hand.,##STEP##Put the pony's muzzle through the loop meant for the nose, making sure not to let the halter get twisted.,##STEP##Put the top of the halter carefully over the pony's ears.,##STEP##To lead the pony, clip a lead rope to one of the rings on the halter.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##To tie a pony, use a slip knot or a quick release knot.

title: How to Clean and Organize Your Tack Room
headline: ##STEP##Take everything from the tack room and set in it the shade somewhere outside.,##STEP##Hang rugs, saddle cloths and boots out to air in a breeze if possible.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Take everything out of storage boxes making sure any dust, dirt and hair also comes out.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Take plastic storage containers and hose them with mild soap and water, them let them dry in the sun facing on a side.,##STEP##Put any suitable small items in the water to soak.,##STEP##Shake/wipe the excess water off and dry them with a towel or cloth.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Dust any shelves, saddle racks, bridle hooks, cabinets, tables, surfaces, etc.,##STEP##Sweep the whole tack room.,##STEP##If the floor is really dirty, use a floor cleaner to get the remaining gunk off.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Now to clean the bathroom (if the tack room has one).,##STEP##Replace or fix anything that is broken.,##STEP##Re-pack the storage boxes.,##STEP##Bring the storage boxes back in and put them away.,##STEP##Put up the saddles on the racks.,##STEP##Wipe the tack with a damp cloth and cover the saddle with a breathable cover or clean saddlecloth.,##STEP##Wash any dirty rugs and saddle cloths.##STEP####STEP##

title: How to Clean Horse Tack1
headline: ##STEP##Head over to the nearest horse supply store and purchase a couple bars of glycerin soap (it's cheap), a soft cloth, a sponge, and leather conditioner.,##STEP##Keep a bar right next to the place where you tack up your horse, along with a small bucket of water and a sponge.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Every time you are finished riding, dampen the sponge (with a good wring out), swipe it on the soap and give your saddle and bridle a quick once over.,##STEP##Dry off the saddle with a clean towel or if you air dry you will have to use oil to get the mosser back into the tack.,##STEP##Get some leather conditioner (preferably marketed specifically for horse tack) and put it on the saddle.,##STEP##Remove the stirrup leathers from the saddle and set them aside.,##STEP##Clean as above.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Dip the bit and stirrups in a bucket of pure, room-temperature water.

title: How to Clean Horse Tack2
headline: ##STEP##Remove the stirrup leathers and stirrups from the saddle.,##STEP##Get your tack cleaning sponge and get it soaking wet, then squeeze most of the water out until it is no longer dripping at all.,##STEP##Rub the soapy sponge all over the saddle, working up a nice lather.,##STEP##Wipe all excess lather off of the saddle with a rag once you are done.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Put neatsfoot oil on a separate sponge (you will never get oil out of the sponge), but just enough to make it very slightly damp with oil.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Rub the oil all over your saddle, making sure to get the bottom and all nooks and crannies.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Once the oil dries, put leather conditioner on a rag and rub it all over the saddle.,##STEP##Repeat these steps on the stirrup leathers.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Reattach the stirrup leathers: remember, if you have safety stirrups, the rubber bands go towards the FRONT of the saddle.##STEP####STEP##

title: How to Clean Horse Tack3
headline: ##STEP##Take the bridle apart by undoing all of the buckles on it, making sure to note which holes all of the buckles are on.,##STEP##Take the bit and put it in a bowl of very hot water.,##STEP##Clean each separate piece of the bridle thoroughly, using the same soap-oil-conditioner process as used for the saddle.,##STEP##Remove the bit from the hot water and rub away any gunk that may be left on it.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Carefully put the bridle back together in the same way that it was before you took it apart.,##STEP##Clean any other leather tack items (martingale, breastplate, draw reins, cruppers, etc.)

title: How to Clean and Oil a Leather Bridle
headline: ##STEP##Make sure you have the right equipment and cleaning products.,##STEP##Select the piece of gear that requires cleaning.,##STEP##Look at your bridle before undoing any buckles.,##STEP##Undo reins and bit from the bridle.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Soak the bit in a bucket of warm water.,##STEP##Undo all buckles and put the pieces in a formation so it resembles a bridle and where each piece should go.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Start by using the first cloth to rub down the leather, making sure you remove any built up grass and dirt.,##STEP##Oil the bridle so it is shiny.,##STEP##Rub the leather down so you remove most of the oil and wax.,##STEP##Using the final cloth, polish the leather, using short quick movements.,##STEP##Using the tooth picks, poke every hole to remove wax and oil.,##STEP##Ensure you have an old toothbrush (not your younger sister's), and toothpaste.,##STEP##Rinse the bit and let dry.,##STEP##Put all the leather pieces back together.,##STEP##Find any problems such as cuts and stains.

title: How to Halter a Horse
headline: ##STEP##Prepare your halter.,##STEP##Call the horse.,##STEP##Approach with the halter in your left hand.,##STEP##Walk slowly to the horse's left side.,##STEP##Allow your horse to sniff your hand.,##STEP##Position the halter in the same direction as the horse's head.,##STEP##Loop the lead line over the horse's head.,##STEP##Guide the halter over the nose and ears.,##STEP##Buckle the halter.,##STEP##Reassure your horse as needed.,##STEP##Make sure the halter fits properly.,##STEP##Practice basic safety guidelines.,##STEP##Start young, if possible.,##STEP##Handle your horse's head, ears, and neck.,##STEP##Introduce your horse to the halter.,##STEP##Practice leading.,##STEP##Avoid punishing your horse.

title: How to Inspect Your Tack Before Mounting
headline: ##STEP##Check your tack every single time before you mount any horse.,##STEP##Go to the horse's head and check to be sure the bit is sitting in the horse's mouth properly.,##STEP##Check the noseband so it's not too tight nor too loose.,##STEP##Check the throat latch to be sure it is not too loose or too tight.,##STEP##Check the reins next to be sure they are fastened properly onto the bit and that the ends are tucked into their keepers as well.,##STEP##Move onto the saddle next.,##STEP##Review any leg wraps.,##STEP##Check the martingale.,##STEP##Get ready to ride!

title: How to Buy a Saddle
headline: ##STEP##Set your budget.,##STEP##Research fair prices.,##STEP##Purchase from a reputable retailer.,##STEP##Read up on saddle types.,##STEP##Determine what the saddle’s main use will be.,##STEP##Choose leather or synthetic.,##STEP##Maintain adequate space between pommel.,##STEP##Measure saddletree size and shape on Western saddles.,##STEP##Check for tightness on English saddle.,##STEP##Gauge appropriate saddle size.,##STEP##Buy a saddle that fits your horse's build.,##STEP##Observe your horse’s response to the saddle.

title: How to Bridle a Horse for Dressage
headline: ##STEP##Take the halter off the horse.,##STEP##Hold up the bridle and align everything to avoid tangles.,##STEP##Put the headstall on the horse gently, bit first, remembering to push the ears forward one at a time, not reaching through and pulling them forward uncomfortably.,##STEP##Fasten the throatlatch.,##STEP##Fasten the noseband (or cavesson) approx one inch below the cheek bone, about half-way between the corner of his eye and top of his nostril.,##STEP##Fasten the flash and situate the buckle.,##STEP##Examine the bridle from the front and both sides.,##STEP##Store the bridle.

title: How to Tack up a Horse
headline: ##STEP##Tie your horse.,##STEP##Groom the horse.,##STEP##If you want to do the bridle first, tie your pony's head-collar so that it is around his neck.,##STEP##Put on the saddle pad/blanket/cloth.,##STEP##Place the saddle gently on the horse's back.,##STEP##Put on his cinch or girth.,##STEP##Put on the horse's boots.,##STEP##Unbuckle the cross ties.,##STEP##Hold the crown, noseband, and throat latch in your right thumb, under and over the horse's head.,##STEP##Put the crown/headpiece of the bridle over the horse's ears.,##STEP##Buckle the throat latch.,##STEP##Buckle the nose band.,##STEP##If you have a flash, buckle it.,##STEP##Mount your horse and you are ready to ride!

title: How to Break In a New English Saddle
headline: ##STEP##Make sure your girth fits.,##STEP##It is best to break in a saddle with an older set of well maintained stirrup leathers.,##STEP##Do not ride in your saddle the day you bring it home.,##STEP##Tack up your horse being very careful to have your girth adjusted and the buckle of your stirrup leathers pulled up to the stirrup bar.,##STEP##Ride as usual for at least an hour.,##STEP##CHECK YOUR GIRTH FREQUENTLY!,##STEP##When you have completed the ride.,##STEP##Lightly treat the underside of the saddle as above.,##STEP##You can work the billets with a glycerin wash. Knead the glycerin in until they become more pliable.,##STEP##Buff the top leather with a soft flannel cloth.,##STEP##Allow the saddle to sit for 2 to 3 days before putting into use.

title: How to Put Bit Guards on a Horse's Bit
headline: ##STEP####STEP##Thread a piece of twine through one of the bit guards and tie the ends together to make a loop.,##STEP####STEP##Put your foot through one of the loops and press your weight down.##STEP##,##STEP####STEP##Pull up on the other loop to stretch the bit guard enough to pass the bit through the opening.##STEP##,##STEP####STEP##Cut both twine pieces near the knot and remove them from the bit guard.##STEP##,##STEP####STEP##Using the same two pieces of twine, repeat steps 2-4 to put on the second bit guard.##STEP##,##STEP####STEP##When you bridle your horse, put one bit guard on each side of his mouth.

title: How to Bridle a Horse1
headline: ##STEP##Check that you have the correct bridle size.,##STEP##Halter your horse so the main part is around the horse's neck.,##STEP##Pick up and position your bridle.,##STEP##Drape the reins over your horse's neck.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Switch hands holding the bridle.,##STEP##Have the horse drop his head for the bit.,##STEP##Slip the crown of the bridle over the horse’s ears.,##STEP##Adjust the brow band.,##STEP##Buckle the throatlatch.,##STEP##Check the fit of the bridle.,##STEP##Remove the halter once you’re satisfied with the bridle’s positioning.,##STEP##Hold your horse by sliding the reins from their neck and gathering them in your hand.

title: How to Know if a Middle School Boy Likes You
headline: ##STEP##Look at the obvious.,##STEP##Talk to him.,##STEP##Text him.,##STEP##Become friends with his friends, guys like having a girlfriend that's comfortable being with him and his friends.,##STEP##Become friends with him, but don't become too close or it could ruin your chance with him.,##STEP##Does he want you to help him with projects or always pick you as his partner in school?,##STEP##Does he always give you hugs?,##STEP##Does he always smile when he looks at you, or shows interest?

title: How to Bridle a Horse2
headline: ##STEP##Pick Western style riding for more informal riding.,##STEP##Check that you have the correct bridle size.,##STEP##Make sure that both you and the horse are calm.,##STEP##Secure your horse.,##STEP##Have your horse drop their head.,##STEP##Slip the bit into your horse’s mouth with the treat.,##STEP##Keep pressure on the crown while slipping it over their ears.,##STEP##Give your horse a treat for being good.,##STEP##Remove the halter once the main part of the bridle is on the horse.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Buckle the throatlatch.,##STEP##Check the bridle's fit.,##STEP##Gather your reins in your right hand.

title: How to Know When to Tell Someone You Like Them
headline: ##STEP##Have self confidence.,##STEP##Spend some time together.,##STEP##Find somewhere you and this person can be alone together, even if you're just behind the crowd talking to each other.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Get comfortable with the person.,##STEP##Go with your gut.,##STEP##If you are friends but not in regular contact then, you have to get them to interact with you and then you have to be with them to then tell them how you feel.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##It will probably be a moment where you're talking alone with this person when you can say "I was wondering, do you like me?,##STEP##It might feel like there never is a time to tell them.,##STEP##Always tell the truth to them Be honest; everyone likes somebody who will tell them the truth, even if that's not exactly what they wanted to hear.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Don't go straight out and ask your crush do they like you.,##STEP##Become good friends with your crush and get to know them.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Compliment them and make it clear that you admire and appreciate them.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Some playful teasing is ok but never be mean or cruel and then act as if it was a joke because that will only turn them off of you.##STEP####STEP##,Hug them at lunchtime or something, but not every hour of the day##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Text them a little bit after you saw each other.

title: How to Get Your Crush to Like You (Junior High)
headline: ##STEP##If you like him/her, make sure you're nice to them.,##STEP##Be friends with this person.,##STEP##Get him wanting you.,##STEP##Be approachable.,##STEP##If he doesn't ask you to go see a movie, or go to the dance or whatever, ask him.,##STEP##If nothing works for that date?,##STEP##If he says yes, tell him all the details, and when you're getting ready for this event, dress appropriately.,##STEP##If he thinks that these are just two friends hanging out, try to show him, it's not.,##STEP##TRY TO NOT RUN OUT OF THINGS TO SAY.,##STEP##After around 3 or so get togethers, when you get to know him, he gets to know you, it's time to show your feelings.,##STEP##If he says I like you back, then yay!,##STEP##If he says he likes someone else, move on.Say "Oh okay" and check your watch or phone.

headline: ##STEP##Tell the friend that you asked if he liked you and he said yes.,##STEP##If they don't believe you, tell them he flirts with you, for example, whispering I love you in your ear, or any other type of little flirting.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Tell them he is staring at you at the moment you are speaking.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Remember: Don't act like you're lying.

headline: ##STEP##Discover her conscious romantic standards.,##STEP##Figure out her unconscious criteria.,##STEP##Chart out her love map.,##STEP##Meet her friends.,##STEP##Contemplate her past relationship(s).,##STEP##Learn what thrills her.,##STEP##Research her preferred method of exercise.,##STEP##Use mutual friends to your advantage.,##STEP##Use repetition.,##STEP##Set the mood with soft lighting.,##STEP##Cultivate your mystique.,##STEP##Flirt with her.,##STEP##Be persistent, when appropriate.,##STEP##Don't rush yourself.,##STEP##Gauge her feelings.,##STEP##Ask her friends.,##STEP##Choose your moment carefully.,##STEP##Get comfortable with your own vulnerability.,##STEP##Reassure her while telling how you feel.,##STEP##Express your feelings honestly.,##STEP##Try winning her over if you think she likes you back.,##STEP##Try it once if you're not sure how she'll respond.,##STEP##Beware sharing your feelings if you value the friendship.,##STEP##Always take no for an answer.

title: How to Make Your Guy Friend Want to Date You
headline: ##STEP##Use body language.,##STEP##Mimic his body language and mannerisms.,##STEP##Strive to look your best around him.,##STEP##Be confident during your interactions.,##STEP##Spend a lot of time together.,##STEP##Emphasize your similarities.,##STEP##Get into some of his interests and hobbies.,##STEP##Try to spend more time alone with him.,##STEP##Initiate touch whenever possible.,##STEP##Try asking him on a date indirectly at first.,##STEP##Make the first move.,##STEP##Take your time.,##STEP##Be direct.,##STEP##Prepare for possible rejection.You cannot control someone else's feelings.,##STEP##Stay strong.

title: How to Lie About Your Crush Being Your Boyfriend2
headline: ##STEP##Come up with a whole story line and stick with it.,##STEP##Tell this whole story through and through, and again, don't be nervous.,##STEP##If someone asks how you kissed, don't say making out or tongues, but details on how you moved your tongues.,##STEP##Try to avoid the setting your friend, you, and your crush were both in.,##STEP##If you want to be extra convincing, make a video that you were supposed to make about something else and then be tripped by him (make it quick so it's convincing) and make all kinds of kissing sounds.

title: How to Lie About Your Crush Being Your Boyfriend3
headline: ##STEP##Again, come up with a whole story, and stick with it.,##STEP##If you know how to write like your crush, write a note in his hand writing saying, Will you go out with me, (your name)?,##STEP##If you prefer, tell a story if you really do have each other's phone numbers.,##STEP##If you have an iPhone, there are websites where you can make fake text messages.,##STEP##Now come up with casual stories about dates and you're good to go!##STEP####STEP##

title: How to Lie About Your Crush Being Your Boyfriend4
headline: ##STEP##All good relationships must come to an end.,##STEP##Try to find days you know you'll be absent right after those days to tell your friends you two broke up.,##STEP##Act sad when you tell them the news, or even command yourself to cry.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Remember: There IS someone out there you won't have to lie about.

title: How to Know if You're Falling for Your Best Friend
headline: ##STEP##Notice the telltale sign of butterflies in your stomach.,##STEP##Notice your inability to concentrate.,##STEP##Recognize those dreams of a future together.,##STEP##Consider whether you think about him or her every minute of every day.,##STEP##Notice your daydreaming.,##STEP##Note how music leaves you feeling.,##STEP##Consider how easy it is for you to stay put.,##STEP##Think about how it feels when you're apart.,##STEP##Consider if suddenly you seem to care about what he or she thinks of you.,##STEP##Think about how you feel when together.

title: How to Go from Friend to Girlfriend
headline: ##STEP##Pretty yourself up!,##STEP##Flirt, flirt, flirt!,##STEP##Talk about things you both like and throw in some jokes.,##STEP##Be yourself.,##STEP##Just come out and say it.

title: How to Go from Dating to Being Friends Again
headline: ##STEP##Minimize contact.,##STEP##Put away items that remind you of the person.,##STEP##Discuss how much time the two of you won't be in contact for one another.,##STEP##If either of you decides to date someone new, and you do want to maintain a friendship with them, then let them know what is happening.,##STEP##Despite your best efforts, you may find that a friendship isn't possible for months, or possibly ever again.

title: How to Make Your Girlfriend Jealous
headline: ##STEP##Know that jealousy masks deeper emotions.,##STEP##Evaluate your girlfriend’s self-confidence.,##STEP##Find out about your girlfriend’s past.,##STEP##Pay attention to her.,##STEP##Establish boundaries.,##STEP##Avoid things that can legitimately be considered threatening.,##STEP##Make plans on your own.,##STEP##Utilize social media.,##STEP##Immerse yourself at work.,##STEP##Become friendly with your girlfriend's female friends.,##STEP##Compliment other women.,##STEP##Speak to women in front of her.,##STEP##Bring a third wheel.

title: How to Play With a Bad Boy's Heart
headline: ##STEP##Don't flirt with this person anymore.,##STEP##Flirt with his acquaintances.,##STEP##Seem busy.,##STEP##If you are dating this player, look great, and make sure everything about you is perfect.,##STEP##Be a bad girl.,##STEP##Begin playing him.,##STEP##If the player starts to get more and more clingy, saying stuff like "I need you," and other junk, start to let him in a little bit.,##STEP##Make the decision.

title: How to Stop Treating Your Boyfriend Like a Crush
headline: ##STEP##Accept that this is a transition.,##STEP##Be aware that when crushing you may have formed an ideal of your boyfriend.,##STEP##Tell people that the two of you are dating.,##STEP##Be comfortable in your boyfriend's presence.,##STEP##Be affectionate.,##STEP##Care for your boyfriend.,##STEP##Aim to have fun.,##STEP##Care for your own needs.

title: How to Get a Crush's, Boyfriend's, or Girlfriend's Email1
headline: ##STEP##Calm yourself before going up to the person.,##STEP##Approach them and ask for their email.,##STEP##Dont overreact if they don't exchange emails with you.,##STEP##Give him/her your email if they say yes.

title: How to Get a Crush's, Boyfriend's, or Girlfriend's Email2
headline: ##STEP##Get together two or three of your friends in a class that you all (including your crush) have together.,##STEP##Begin to talk and trade emails.,##STEP##If done correctly your crush will come to see what you're doing.,##STEP##Explain to him/her that you are trading emails.,##STEP##Have one of your friends invite him/her to swap his/hers email also.,##STEP##He/she should now be giving everyone, including you, his/her email.,##STEP##When you get home that day enter his/her email into your address book.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Send him/her and all of your friends who were "swapping" emails a "test email".,##STEP##If he/she emails you back, great!,##STEP##If you don't get a reply, don't worry!

title: How to Know if She Doesn't Like You Anymore
headline: ##STEP##Observe her body position when she is with you.,##STEP##Study her eye contact.,##STEP##Notice how much she touches you.,##STEP##Keep track of how often she cancels plans or is too busy to go out.,##STEP##Notice the type of dates she wants to have.,##STEP##Pay attention to how she behaves with you in social gatherings like a party.,##STEP##Take notice how often she calls or texts.,##STEP##Pay attention to how she talks to other guys.,##STEP##Listen to what she says about other guys.,##STEP##See if she gets jealous.,##STEP##Notice what kind of fights you have with her.,##STEP##Ask her how she feels about your relationship.,##STEP##Listen actively when she is talking.,##STEP##Make changes based on the conversation.

title: How to Make a Guy at School You Hardly See Jealous of Other Guys
headline: ##STEP##Be yourself and stay who you are.,##STEP##Do not change the way you dress, the way you look,or apply new make-up.,##STEP##Let him notice you.,##STEP##Talk with other guys in places where your target guy will see you doing so, if it's normal for you to talk to guys.,##STEP##If he just sees you with guy friends in general no flirting or anything, or doesn't even listen to your conversation, do not stare at him at all, or don't stare at him as much as you usually do.,##STEP##Make him want your attention.,##STEP##Do not act like your "all that" and/or "popular/conceited" or something in any way.,##STEP##Be friendly and nice to him.,##STEP##Act normal for you and how you feel is cool around him and act as if you never stared at him or liked him.

title: How to Know if a Guy Secretly Wants You Back After a Fight
headline: ##STEP##See if he ignores you.,##STEP##When he DOES get in contact with you, does he say you're annoying or "Don't talk to me" or "Stop texting me".,##STEP##When he sees your attention on other boys, pay close attention to his reaction.,##STEP##If he sees you with just people that get along with you in general,what's his point of view?,##STEP##Does he avoid you.,##STEP##Does he talk bad about you to other people.,##STEP##When you don't give him attention,does he care.,##STEP##& From here on out, you'll see if he still wants to continue having you in his life.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Always remember this: "In the end, the truth ALWAYS comes out no matter what happens".##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Remember this saying, to: "The More You Hate Someone, The More You love Someone.,##STEP##~Good Luck & I Wish You The Best!!!!

title: How to Catch Your Crush's Attention1
headline: ##STEP##Spend extra time on your appearance.,##STEP##Look different.,##STEP##Wear red.,##STEP##Don’t go overboard with your outfit.,##STEP##Make sure your crush has seen you around.,##STEP##Get more involved.

title: How to Confess to Your Crush1
headline: ##STEP##Write a note and pass it to your crush.,##STEP##Introduce the idea without saying anything.,##STEP##Ask for help with something.,##STEP##Let it "slip out" to someone else.,##STEP##Find reasons to invite the person out.,##STEP##Just flirt.

title: How to Catch Your Crush's Attention2
headline: ##STEP##Meet your crush’s friends.,##STEP##Flirt non-verbally.,##STEP##Start a conversation.,##STEP##Talk about common interests.,##STEP##Ask her about herself.,##STEP##Be a good listener.,##STEP##Compliment your crush.,##STEP##Laugh at his jokes.,##STEP##Stay in contact.

title: How to Catch Your Crush's Attention3
headline: ##STEP##Define your style.,##STEP##Speak your voice.,##STEP##Use social media.,##STEP##Use confident body language.

title: How to Confess to Your Crush2
headline: ##STEP##Don't wait.,##STEP##Try to stay calm and cool.,##STEP##Introduce yourself, if necessary.,##STEP##Talk one-on-one, in person.,##STEP##Have a specific date or event in mind to follow up with.,##STEP##Just cut to the chase.,##STEP##Don't worry about rejection.

title: How to Confess to Your Crush3
headline: ##STEP##Befriend them online first, if you haven't already.,##STEP##Make sure your crush isn't seeing anyone.,##STEP##Talk to mutual friends about your crush.,##STEP##Hang out in groups.,##STEP##Pay attention.

title: How to Become Best Friends with Your Crush
headline: ##STEP##Don't be shy!,##STEP##Talk about a subject he/she likes, preferably not about school.,##STEP##Ask for help on your homework.,##STEP##Over time, gain his/her trust by trusting them in return.,##STEP##Be yourself.,##STEP##Take an interest in his/her life.,##STEP##Don't talk about personal stuff, such as ex-boyfriends or ex-girlfriends.,##STEP##Don't dive in too fast or your crush will know you like him/her.

title: How to Be Good at Conversations With Your Crush
headline: ##STEP##Pick a good time.,##STEP##Greet them casually.,##STEP##Compliment them on something.,##STEP##Note their body language.,##STEP##Find common ground.,##STEP##Find a reason to continue the conversation.,##STEP##Offer an invitation.,##STEP##Set yourself up to feel good.,##STEP##Remember they’re just like you.,##STEP##Smile and make eye contact.,##STEP##Give yourself a pep talk.

title: How to Talk to a Crush Who Hates You
headline: ##STEP##Find out why they hate you through a friend.,##STEP##Address any misunderstandings.,##STEP##Apologize and make things right, if needed.,##STEP##Choose a good time to talk.,##STEP##Smile.,##STEP##Try easy conversation starters.,##STEP##Discuss mutual friends.,##STEP##Draw on joint activities.,##STEP##Ask about their interests.,##STEP##Be kind, not argumentative.

title: How to Be Close to Your Crush
headline: ##STEP##Find common interests.,##STEP##Start off as friends.,##STEP##Be a good listener.,##STEP##Be yourself.,##STEP##Have confidence.,##STEP##Be approachable and kind.,##STEP##Take care of your appearance.,##STEP##Avoid over-analyzing the situation.,##STEP##Make time to talk one-on-one.,##STEP##Use your body language.,##STEP##Flirt with your crush.,##STEP##Give them space.

title: How to Avoid Messing Up Your First Impression
headline: ##STEP##Be polite.,##STEP##Look nice.,##STEP##Listen to what they have to say.,##STEP##Be Interested.,##STEP##Be Fun and Nice.,##STEP##Compliment them on something.,##STEP##Smile- When approaching someone, greet them face-to-face with a smile.,##STEP##Never interrupt/disturb.,##STEP##Don't flirt.,##STEP##Be Calm.,##STEP##The goodbye.

title: How to Stop Liking Your Crush1
headline: ##STEP##Distance yourself from them.,##STEP##Remove their contact information and text messages from your phone.,##STEP##Remove them from social media sites.,##STEP##Stop talking about them and don’t allow yourself to think about them.,##STEP##Ask your friends not to bring them up.,##STEP##Avoid places they and their friends go.,##STEP##Get rid of tangible traces of them.,##STEP##Allow yourself to grieve and don’t get mad.,##STEP##Know you’ll find someone else.

title: How to Stop Liking Your Crush2
headline: ##STEP##Lean on your support system.,##STEP##Focus on yourself and your other interests.,##STEP##Try new activities.,##STEP##Meet new people.,##STEP##Consider flirting or dating someone else.

title: How to Attract Your Crush
headline: ##STEP##Work on being the best you.,##STEP##Take care of yourself.,##STEP##Keep yourself clean.,##STEP##Look nice.,##STEP##Be confident!,##STEP##Show them how wonderful you are.,##STEP##Be a good friend.,##STEP##Spend time together.,##STEP##Get to know them.,##STEP##Let them get to know you.,##STEP##Find things in common.,##STEP##Share in their passions.,##STEP##Let them be their own person.,##STEP##Show your availability.,##STEP##Flirt with them.,##STEP##Touch them.,##STEP##Tell them that you like them.,##STEP##Ask them out.

title: How to Befriend a Crush (Boys or Girls)1
