title: How to Be Crushed on in School (Girls)
headline: ##STEP##Be clean.,##STEP##Have gorgeous hair.,##STEP##Have a sense of style.,##STEP##Be healthy.,##STEP##Be a good student.,##STEP##Smile.,##STEP##Make up a secret nickname for your crush with your closest friends.,##STEP##Get him to notice you.,##STEP##Try to start flirting.

title: How to Ask Your Crush to the Dance
headline: ##STEP##Look for signs of interest.,##STEP##Make your feelings known.,##STEP##Hint to your crush that you want to go the dance.,##STEP##Ask them in person.,##STEP##Ask them via text.,##STEP##Leave them a note.,##STEP##Give them baked goods.,##STEP##Play hangman.,##STEP##Put a note in a fortune cookie.,##STEP##Make a mix CD.,##STEP##Send them a message in a bottle.

title: How to Turn Down a Boy when He Asks You Out
headline: ##STEP##Ask him why he's interested in you.,##STEP##Watch how they act when they tell you why they're interested in you.,##STEP##If he is a really genuine person imagine you are in his shoes.,##STEP##Calmly and gently say that you are really sorry, but you don't see him in that way.,##STEP##Apologize for leading him on or giving him signs, even if you didn't notice or mean to.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Wait for his reply.,##STEP##Change the subject, where possible, and try to act like it hasn't happened.,##STEP##Imagine you are the boy... it probably took a good while for him to build up the courage to ask you out.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##You can always tell him that you are flattered that he asked you out, but that you're not interested in pursuing something romantic with him.##STEP####STEP##

title: How to Be a Secret Admirer on Valentine's Day
headline: ##STEP##Start out with a simple card.,##STEP##Write a thoughtful message to your crush.,##STEP##Disguise your handwriting.,##STEP##Sign both their name and yours.,##STEP##Give them gifts.,##STEP##Deliver your card or gift.,##STEP##Do thoughtful acts of kindness for them.,##STEP##Plan a scavenger hunt for your crush.,##STEP##Drop clues to hint at your identity.,##STEP##Pick a time to reveal yourself.,##STEP##Choose a public place.,##STEP##Tell your crush where and how to find you.,##STEP##Introduce yourself as their Secret Admirer.,##STEP##Learn more about your crush.,##STEP##Talk to their friends and family.,##STEP##Take note of their schedule.,##STEP##Avoid getting to know them too well.,##STEP##Make a plan.

title: How to Tell a Guy You Aren't Interested in a Relationship1
headline: ##STEP##Be polite when you hear the guy's request.,##STEP##Avoid interrupting.

title: How to Tell a Guy You Aren't Interested in a Relationship2
headline: ##STEP##Avoid coming out with just a "no".,##STEP##Reject his advance with a compliment.,##STEP##Try not to make it to embarrassing for him.,##STEP##Make it seem as if anybody who asked you out right now would not succeed.,##STEP##Keep it short and sweet.

title: How to Tell a Guy You Don't Like Him Back
headline: ##STEP##Know that he likes you.,##STEP##Don’t procrastinate.,##STEP##Don’t avoid him forever.,##STEP##Make a plan.,##STEP##Talk over the phone.,##STEP##Acknowledge the seriousness.,##STEP##Be nice.,##STEP##Give him your “back-off” message.,##STEP##Ensure him that your feelings aren’t going to change.,##STEP##Be honest.,##STEP##Be willing to listen.,##STEP##Agree to end the conversation.,##STEP##Be polite.,##STEP##Give him space.,##STEP##Don’t lead him on.

title: How to Forget a Cheating Boyfriend
headline: ##STEP##Exercise to regulate your mood.,##STEP##Pick up an old hobby.,##STEP##Watch lighthearted television.,##STEP##Stay around people.,##STEP##Allow yourself to think about your ex in moderation.,##STEP##Remind yourself that it was your ex’s decision to cheat.,##STEP##Remember the bad parts of the relationship.,##STEP##Cut off contact with your ex.,##STEP##Talk things out with only a few people.,##STEP##Do not seek out details.,##STEP##Use self-soothing activities to feel better.,##STEP##Take care of yourself.,##STEP##Remind yourself you want to be happy.,##STEP##Embrace the good in yourself.,##STEP##Look towards the future with a positive attitude.,##STEP##Rebuild your self-confidence.

title: How to Forget a Girl Who Hurt You Emotionally1
headline: ##STEP##Get physical distance.,##STEP##Get rid of the evidence.,##STEP##Cut off communication.,##STEP##Avoid hanging out with her friends.

title: How to Talk Your Boyfriend out of Breaking up With You
headline: ##STEP##Agree that changes need to be made, and the relationship cannot continue as it is.,##STEP##Sincerely try to empathize with his misgivings about the relationship.,##STEP##Look for concrete ways for how some of his needs might be addressed.,##STEP##Remember you are not trying to "win" an argument.,##STEP##Express yourself clearly.,##STEP##Be patient.,##STEP##Be on his side.,##STEP##Avoid manipulative tactics.,##STEP##Acknowledge your feelings of abandonment.,##STEP##Be your most mature self.,##STEP##Believe that you are worth staying with, and act that way.

title: How to Forget a Girl Who Hurt You Emotionally2
headline: ##STEP##Let yourself be sad.,##STEP##Give yourself a timeline.,##STEP##Talk it out.

title: How to Forget a Girl Who Hurt You Emotionally3
headline: ##STEP##Go on dates.,##STEP##Exercise your social muscles.,##STEP##Find new ways to be social.

title: How to Forget a Girl Who Hurt You Emotionally4
headline: ##STEP##Find a new goal.,##STEP##Go to the gym.,##STEP##Focus on yourself.,##STEP##Get a new hobby.,##STEP##Get some perspective.

title: How to Write a Breakup Letter
headline: ##STEP##Figure out if a letter is the best means for breaking up.,##STEP##Consider other options.,##STEP##Decide how to deliver the letter.,##STEP##Be honest about the letter's intent.,##STEP##Explain specifics.,##STEP##Be kind.,##STEP##Give yourself time to grieve.,##STEP##Understand biology plays a role in breakups.,##STEP##Resist negative feelings.

title: How to Survive a Break Up (Girls)
headline: ##STEP##Do not cry in front of them - you don’t want to look like a basket case and make them think that they're making the right decision.,##STEP##Get in the car and let out a good scream when you’re at least two blocks away from their house.,##STEP##Drive to your best friend’s house for a shoulder to cry on.,##STEP##Cry.,##STEP##Box up all the things that they gave you, or that remind you of them.,##STEP##Print out all emails they sent you; gather up all letters they wrote you.,##STEP##Cut off all contact with them for at least a month; this will help the healing process because you won’t be talking to them all the time.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##If you see them regularly at work or school, always look good.,##STEP##When they do come back around, (because you’re too great of a girl for them to not come back), make them work for your attention.,##STEP##If you let them back in, make sure you're strict about you staying.

title: How to Stop Crying over Your Ex Every Day
headline: ##STEP##Cry one final time.,##STEP##Remove trigger items.,##STEP##Remove the person from your social media and contact lists.,##STEP##Practice deep breathing.,##STEP##Stop ruminating.,##STEP##Smile.,##STEP##Learn to avoid crying spells before they begin.,##STEP##Spend time with loved ones.,##STEP##Join a new activity.,##STEP##Exercise.Although you might feel like staying home, leave the house and take a walk or run.,##STEP##Consider changing your style.,##STEP##Make healthy choices.

title: How to Successfully Disconnect from Your Ex After a Breakup
headline: ##STEP##Accept the breakup completely.,##STEP##Get rid of all relationship memorabilia.,##STEP##Refrain from over-elaborating on the breakup.,##STEP##Reduce spending time with mutual friends.,##STEP##Avoid venues and events which may result in a run-in.,##STEP##Refrain from discussing your ex at all times.,##STEP##Never contact your ex for any reason.

title: How to Tell Someone You Don't Want to Go on Another Date
headline: ##STEP##Minimize possible damage from first dates.,##STEP##Be kind.,##STEP##Take the high road.,##STEP##Don't beat around the bush.,##STEP##Address the situation directly: Being direct and honest need not be harsh or mean.,##STEP##Keep to your decision.

title: How to Say Bye to Your Holiday Boyfriend
headline: ##STEP##Make sure you are not already having a huge fight over the end of the holiday season or that you have led him up the garden path about your intentions.,##STEP##Find a private area where you can talk and not create a scene.,##STEP##Simply sit down and let him know how you feel.,##STEP##Listen to what he has to say.,##STEP##Leave on good terms.

title: How to Reject Someone Without Breaking Their Heart1
headline: ##STEP##Tell the truth.,##STEP##Use a "compliment sandwich".,##STEP##Be direct.,##STEP##Treat the person with respect.,##STEP##Communicate effectively.

title: How to Break Up With Your Girlfriend in High School
headline: ##STEP##Think about why you are breaking up with her.,##STEP##Practice what you are going to say.,##STEP##Figure out how to respond to her.,##STEP##Find a private time and place to do it.,##STEP##Do it in person.,##STEP##Talk about the positives with the negatives.,##STEP##Listen to her.,##STEP##Be ready to feel emotional.,##STEP##Don’t jump right back into dating.,##STEP##Reach out to your friends.,##STEP##Don’t contact your ex-girlfriend.,##STEP##Be nice to your ex-girlfriend.

title: How to Reinvent Yourself After a Break Up (Girls)
headline: ##STEP##Be gentle with yourself.,##STEP##Eat healthy.,##STEP##Exercise.,##STEP##Reflect on your purpose.,##STEP##Reflect on why and what kind of makeover you want.,##STEP##Treat yourself.,##STEP##Splurge on a new hairstyle or a wardrobe change.,##STEP##Change the inner, not just the outer.,##STEP##Reconnect with what you love.,##STEP##Get rid of what’s holding you back.,##STEP##Try something new.,##STEP##Get out and have fun.,##STEP##Seek out the right relationship.

title: How to Reject Someone Without Breaking Their Heart2
headline: ##STEP##Take responsibility for breaking up.,##STEP##Use compassion.,##STEP##Plan what you want to say.,##STEP##Find a good time.,##STEP##Make a clean break.

title: How to Reject Someone Without Breaking Their Heart3
headline: ##STEP##Watch for red flags.,##STEP##Prioritize your feelings.,##STEP##Confide in someone trustworthy.

title: How to Play a Player1
headline: ##STEP##Ignore him at first.,##STEP##Slowly acknowledge him.,##STEP##Let him see you having fun with your girls.,##STEP##Let him see you having a good time with other guys.,##STEP##Flirt a little bit.,##STEP##Be immune to his charms.

title: How to Prepare Yourself to Break up With Your Boyfriend
headline: ##STEP##Acknowledge that the relationship is really over.,##STEP##Don't delay the inevitable.,##STEP##Make sure you're the one who personally delivers the news.,##STEP##Find or schedule an appropriate time.,##STEP##Show your resolve by being firm, decisive and honest.

title: How to Play a Player2
headline: ##STEP##Be mysterious.,##STEP##Be fun.,##STEP##Make him jealous.,##STEP##Don't be jealous.,##STEP##Limit your communication.,##STEP##Maintain your independence.,##STEP##Beat him at his own game (optional).

title: How to Play a Player3
headline: ##STEP##Have him eating out of your hand.,##STEP##Know when it's time to say goodbye.,##STEP##Cut him loose.,##STEP##Have no mercy.

title: How to Move On1
headline: ##STEP##The Five Stages of Grief.,##STEP##Be sad.,##STEP##Get some alone time.,##STEP##There is a point.,##STEP##Remember your ex.,##STEP##Reflect on your relationship.

title: How to Not Stress over a Breakup
headline: ##STEP##Go out with your friends.,##STEP##Write out your feelings on a piece of paper.,##STEP##Do not become his/her friend UNLESS you are truly And completely OVER HIM/HER!##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Erase all the little notes and messages he gave you or left on your phone.,##STEP##Get it all out.,##STEP##Find some words of wisdom and live by them.,##STEP##Think positively.,##STEP##Never be ashamed of your feelings.,##STEP##Start a new hobby or pastime.,##STEP##Dance it out!!!

title: How to Know if Your Boyfriend Is Going to Dump You
headline: ##STEP##Think about whether he keeps breaking plans or avoiding you.,##STEP##Listen to your conversations.,##STEP##Get physical.,##STEP##Watch his behavior with other girls.,##STEP##Talk to his friends.,##STEP##Does he purposely hang around girls you don't like?,##STEP##If he is constantly telling you he has to go when you're on the phone, he's just making up excuses.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Does he tell you he wants a break?,##STEP##Don't keep annoying him or pestering him as he may think something's going on and may think about dumping you more just act natural.##STEP####STEP##

title: How to Move on and Start Brand New
headline: ##STEP##In order to forget about a previous poor relationship, you first have to get rid of any of that person's belongings.,##STEP##Try going onto Google for more steps on how to forget this person!,##STEP##What other sites provide good information?,##STEP##To forget about a certain someone, simply ask a friend for advice!,##STEP##Try getting into certain hobbies that you've never gotten into once before!,##STEP##Avoid contact with the person that you are trying to avoid.,##STEP##If you catch the person's attention, or accidentally create eye contact, try to fix your eyes on something else or do something different so that that person does not notice you any longer.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Try not to think about the bad things in your relationship and lighten up!,##STEP##Smile!,##STEP##Laugh!,##STEP##Try to hang out with better people and just focus on them mostly.,##STEP##Are you ready to finally start a new chapter?,##STEP##The first part to trying to start brand new is being confident.,##STEP##Meet someone new!,##STEP##Do not try to fall in love too quickly, as this may cause another painful tension in your recent relationship and it just may end up repeating.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Get to know this new person.,##STEP##Once you both fall in love, do not tell this person about your past or anything.,##STEP##Be happy now, because you finally met someone new and you finally have the chance to just be happy.

title: How to Get over Somebody in 30 Days
headline: ##STEP##Get them out of your life - don't call them, text them, e-mail them or visit their Facebook or Myspace account.,##STEP##Be Confident - Show them that you are happier now without them, even if your still hurting.,##STEP##Get rid of anything that reminds you of them - Yes girls, that includes all the jewelry, clothes, chocolates, whatever.,##STEP##Do new things - Do new extreme things like travel, get new friends, get new hobbies, get a complete change in your life.,##STEP##Get a journal - Write down all of the feeling you feel, all the things you do, and all the people you're with until you feel you have moved on.,##STEP##Understand what he/she wants - A big reason people miss or still want to be with their old partners is because you look back at your relationship time after time, analyzing every detail of everything you both have ever done until you want to be with them again, to change everything that you messed up last time.,##STEP##Talk to them - Now that you feel you are pretty much over them, you still have that little bit of curiosity left.,##STEP##This above was an overview of what you should do to get over them, but here is 30 different things you can do to get over them:##STEP####STEP##,Do not call them##STEP####STEP##,Do not text them##STEP####STEP##,Do not e-mail them##STEP####STEP##,Do not visit there Facebook or Myspace##STEP####STEP##,Don't act jealous##STEP####STEP##,Don't be insecure##STEP####STEP##,Don't be desperate##STEP####STEP##,Be confident##STEP####STEP##,Go on with your life##STEP####STEP##,Get a new hobby##STEP####STEP##,Spend time on yourself##STEP####STEP##,Decide if your life is better with or without them (REALLY think about this one)##STEP####STEP##,Learn how to 'let go'##STEP####STEP##,Forgive them##STEP####STEP##,Don't say things you'll regret##STEP####STEP##,Be, feel and act attractive##STEP####STEP##,Take a vacation##STEP####STEP##,Get rid of bad habits that caused problems in that relationship, so you won't have those problems when you find someone new##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Don't try to make them feel guilty.,Don't fear loneliness, embrace it to discover who you are##STEP####STEP##,Be able to admit your mistakes##STEP####STEP##,Go on a blind date##STEP####STEP##,Lose some weight, feel better physically and emotionally##STEP####STEP##,Learn patience##STEP####STEP##,Be yourself##STEP####STEP##,Make sure whatever you didn't like in your past relationship won't be in your next one##STEP####STEP##,Start talking to them again as friends##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Be happy that you can have a new life, stress free.##STEP####STEP##

title: How to Forget About a Girl You Love Who Has a Boyfriend
headline: ##STEP##Try to find someone else that you like.,##STEP##Don't listen to any slow songs or love songs... you will just miss her more.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##If you are friends with her, make it clear to yourself that friendship is all she wants.,##STEP##Be sensitive to her, but not overly.,##STEP##There are other women, who will accept you!,##STEP##Go out and have some fun.,##STEP##Don't cry over a girl who doesn't like you.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Do not let yourself think that you're not attractive, or that you will never find someone better.,##STEP##If she has a Myspace, Facebook, etc, avoid her page.,##STEP##Don't have her within your top 5/10/etc, unless you are practically best friends.,##STEP##Try not to look at her.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##If you start to think about her, then think about someone else.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Don't call or IM her a lot.,##STEP##Unless you have a legit reason, just don't call/text her.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Don't look at her as the most important person in your life.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Say no to her once in a while.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##If you are a student: Forget her because it could affect your mental health, which will directly affect your exams.,##STEP##There are billions of women in the world, one tiny fish in the sea is not going to make your life worse, you have to be confident in your self and realize that you have the guts to move on.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Wasting your time with her is going to make your life worse, realize that she is nothing anymore.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Listen to music, go workout or run, go do a sport you can take your frustration out on ex: Wrestling, Boxing, Hockey etc.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Hang out with your guy friends (only guys) and go out and have a good time.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Don't fight with the boyfriend.,Don't reminisce about the old times##STEP####STEP##,Try not to get kicked out because of her##STEP####STEP##,Don't write songs about her anymore##STEP####STEP##,Find a new best friend##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Don't go to the things that remind you of her like... Ice cream you used to buy for her, your favorite shows, things you used to do together.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Never regret yourself that you loved her .##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Don't think that you are a failure in love.,Stop thinking of what could have been, it will drive you crazy##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Tell yourself she wasn't good enough for you.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Try to stay away from your crush if you both work in the same office.

title: How to Feel Better when You're on a Break from Your Boyfriend
headline: ##STEP##Discuss the reason for the break with your boyfriend.,##STEP##Listen to your boyfriend's concerns, reasons and thoughts.,##STEP##Reach an agreement on what this break means for both of you.,##STEP##Discuss what will change in the relationship and what will stay the same.,##STEP##Consider deciding how long the break will be.,##STEP##Once the break starts, follow the rules you agreed on.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Stay busy.,##STEP##Invest more time in doing work or studying.,##STEP##Devote more time and energy to doing things that make you happy.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Be more social.,##STEP##Re-connect with old friends you may have neglected.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Avoid spending too much time by yourself.,##STEP##Consider avoiding hanging out in situations with a bunch of couples.,##STEP##Catch up now and then.,##STEP##Be honest with your boyfriend about your questions and concerns.,##STEP##Use assertive statements when expressing yourself.,##STEP##Consider how you feel after the break.,##STEP##Think about how you will react if you wish to continue with the relationship but he doesn't.,##STEP##Think about how you will react if both of you wish to resume the relationship.

headline: ##STEP##Know this will take time.,##STEP##Understand the emotions that you are feeling are normal and embrace them.,##STEP##Hide everything that it is too difficult to see right now.,##STEP##Try to keep a regular schedule as best as you can.,##STEP##Try to get your mind off of it.,##STEP##Enjoy spending time with the people who are still in your life.,##STEP##Accept the end of the relationship.

headline: ##STEP##Find a legitimate reason to break up with her.,##STEP##Find a quiet, isolated place free of distractions.,##STEP##Start off blunt.,##STEP##Give her a truthful explanation.,##STEP##Take responsibility for your mistakes, if possible.,##STEP##Be calm and reassuring.,##STEP##Talk to her, but keep the conversation short.,##STEP##Follow the list of "don'ts."

title: How to Win a Girl Back
headline: ##STEP##Give her some space.,##STEP##Give yourself some time to reflect.,##STEP##Stay busy.,##STEP##Let her see you having a great time.,##STEP##Make her jealous (optional).,##STEP##If it was too easy the first time, make her chase you.,##STEP##If it was too hard the first time, make it easier.,##STEP##If you hurt her, apologize.,##STEP##Show what a better, more mature person you've become.,##STEP##Tell her how you feel.,##STEP##Take her out.,##STEP##Keep the girl this time.

title: How to Break Up with Your Girlfriend Nicely
headline: ##STEP##Don't break up with your partner by text, phone or email.,##STEP##Don't place blame solely on the other person for the breakup.,##STEP##Don't lead your ex on.,##STEP##Don't be a blabbermouth.,##STEP##Don't be petty.,##STEP##Try to minimize the heartache.,##STEP##Be prepared for a range of emotions.,##STEP##Give her a truthful explanation.,##STEP##Be reassuring.,##STEP##Offer to talk with her at a later time if she has any questions.

title: How to Tell a Guy That You're Not Allowed to Date
headline: ##STEP##Ask your parents why.,##STEP##Be respectful.,##STEP##Explore compromises.,##STEP##Seek the help of a trusted adult.,##STEP##Understand your feelings.,##STEP##Think before you speak.,##STEP##Deliver the message.,##STEP##Be aware of timing.,##STEP##Ensure he understands your point of view.,##STEP##Don’t apologize or defend yourself.,##STEP##Remain calm.,##STEP##Suggest that you be friends instead.

title: How to Tell a Boy You Aren't Interested in a Relationship
headline: ##STEP##Choose a good time and place to talk.,##STEP##Think about texting him if you're worried about a hostile reaction.,##STEP##Plan what you want to say.,##STEP##Be honest and direct.,##STEP##Withhold some information, if necessary.,##STEP##Be careful about being friends.,##STEP##Lessen contact for awhile.,##STEP##Repeat your rejection if necessary.,##STEP##Ignore him if he keeps pressuring you for a romance.,##STEP##Do not wait to tell him you're not interested.,##STEP##Fade away only under certain circumstances.,##STEP##Do not simply avoid him if you have the same social circle.

title: How to Cope With Being Used by a Boy
headline: ##STEP##Avoid getting even.,##STEP##Keep your distance.,##STEP##Learn from the experience.,##STEP##Take responsibility for how you may have contributed.,##STEP##Forgive.,##STEP##Let go.,##STEP##Express how you feel.,##STEP##Know your basic human rights.,##STEP##Don’t take it personally.,##STEP##Avoid blaming yourself.,##STEP##Practice resiliency.,##STEP##Use self affirmations.,##STEP##Have a solid support network.

title: How to Break Up with a Boy
headline: ##STEP##Figure out what you're going to say.,##STEP##Drop some hints.,##STEP##Do it face-to-face if you can.,##STEP##Pick the right place and time.,##STEP##Tell him it's over.,##STEP##After the break up, let him ask questions.,##STEP##Explain further if it's necessary.,##STEP##Avoid being too mean.,##STEP##Keep it short.,##STEP##Stand your ground.,##STEP##If you want to stay friends, tell him that.,##STEP##End on a good note.,##STEP##Don't try to be friends right away.,##STEP##Take some time to recover emotionally.,##STEP##Don't talk about him behind his back.,##STEP##Keep the public hooking up with other guys to a minimum.,##STEP##See if you can be friends eventually.

title: How to Deal With Heartbreak
headline: ##STEP##Give yourself time.,##STEP##Give yourself space from your ex.,##STEP##Don't fight your feelings.,##STEP##Make plans.,##STEP##Take care of yourself.,##STEP##Impose a daily limit on grieving.,##STEP##Beware of the rebound.,##STEP##Watch how you act online.,##STEP##Remember that your end goal is to move on.,##STEP##Seek help.

title: How to Politely Turn Down a Guy
headline: ##STEP##Before you even say a word, think long and hard about why you don't want to date him/her.,##STEP##If you STILL want to say no,thank this person (if you hung out together) for all the good times you had.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Be clear about your decision, but do not be bluntly honest about the reason.,##STEP##Do not say "I'm not ready for a relationship," or even "I already have a boyfriend/girlfriend,".,##STEP##You are not obligated to discuss or provide a lengthier explanation of why you do not want to date someone.,##STEP##If you already had a friendship, you may ask if you can still be friends.

headline: ##STEP##Be straight with him.,##STEP##Say a clear “no.” Say no to reject a guy who asks you to do something you don’t want to do, and he will get the message and likely change his feelings.,##STEP##Give him logical reasons.,##STEP##Use an excuse if you have to.,##STEP##Offer to set him up with someone else.

headline: ##STEP##Remain calm.,##STEP##Be polite.,##STEP##Start by offering help on his part.,##STEP##Calmly explain to him your feelings.,##STEP##If you have a boyfriend, say so, in a NICE way so it won't hurt him.,##STEP##Wait for his response.,##STEP##If he seems really upset and might cry, tell him sorry and get to class.,##STEP##If he is or may become violent, walk away quickly and tell a trusted adult.##STEP####STEP##

title: How to Deal With a Guy Who Thinks You Like Him1

title: How to Avoid a Guy Who Likes You that Thinks You Like Him
headline: ##STEP##Tell him you don't like him.,##STEP##Pretend that he doesn't exist.,##STEP##Forbid your friends to give him your personal info, including your telephone number, MSN address, email address, etc.,##STEP##One way guys try to get a girl's attention is to hover around her or try to have physical contact with her (ex: brushing past).,##STEP##Although this can be risky, this trick will put him down if you do this correctly.,##STEP##Stay away from him as much as possible.,##STEP##Whenever your friends talk about him, make fun of him a little bit, but be careful not to get carried away.,##STEP##If he keeps on flirting with you like hitting you in the head or messing with your hair, simply turn around and firmly tell him to stop.,##STEP##Smile when he is upset about you not liking him.

title: How to Deal with Admirers1
headline: ##STEP##Take a deep breath.,##STEP##Remember that, even if you feel like you are doing something wrong, it is NOT your fault!,##STEP##Stop smiling, stop frowning, stop wearing masks.

title: How to Avoid a Guy Who Likes You in High School1
headline: ##STEP##Time your day accordingly.,##STEP##Find ways to occupy yourself.,##STEP##Join (or start) a new club.,##STEP##Make a new friend.,##STEP##Stay away from his usual hangouts.,##STEP##Surround yourself with a group.

title: How to Avoid a Girl With a Crush
headline: ##STEP##Talk to her.,##STEP##Give her a few days to let this information sink in.,##STEP##Avoid making eye contact.,##STEP##Nod whenever you pass casually in the hallway and don't smile, so that it's not a greeting, but an acknowledgment.,##STEP##Don't pick up that phone if she calls you!,##STEP##Resist having any conversations with her.,##STEP##Find someone for her to hook up with.

title: How to Deal With a Flirtatious Boy when You Don't Desire a Relationship
headline: ##STEP##Be calm at first and assess the situation.,##STEP##If this boy is a flirt but is flirting more excessively with you than anyone else, be on the cautious side.,##STEP##If you don't want to have a relationship, you should try to make it clear first off.,##STEP##Try not to be caught alone when he may bother you.,##STEP##Keep in mind that while the above mentioned steps will help, they are not guaranteed to stop him.,##STEP##The worst just may happen.,##STEP##If you are meeting in person, you have no choice but to immediately respond.,##STEP##If the encounter happens on Facebook/email or over the phone, you have time and are lucky.,##STEP##It's most likely that after this, you and the boy will avoid each other.

headline: ##STEP##Change your schedule.,##STEP##Change seats.,##STEP##Avoid hanging out with his friends.,##STEP##Avoid online contact.,##STEP##Keep texts or calls short.,##STEP##Pick up a new hobby.

title: How to Repel Your Unwanted Crushes
headline: ##STEP##Make sure there really are no chances.,##STEP##Acknowledge your own sense of embarrassment or discomfort about the situation but don't let this deflect you from your mission of telling it like it is.,##STEP##Once you've tackled your own feelings, quell any desire to laugh off your crush.,##STEP##Be concrete about how you feel.,##STEP##Stay open with one another.,##STEP##Avoid the guilt trip.

title: How to Stop Crushing over an Actor
headline: ##STEP##Stop watching films or TV shows that this actor is in.,##STEP##Delete photos of this actor from your phone.,##STEP##Take down posters of the actor.,##STEP##Look up bad critics of the actor.,##STEP##If you follow the actor on Twitter, unfollow now!,##STEP##Understand that you cannot love somebody you do not know.,##STEP##Keep telling yourself that you don't have a chance with the actor.,##STEP##Avoid substituting the actor's last name as your last name.,##STEP##Be aware of how this obsession is eating into your real life.

title: How to Get over Your Crush Who's a Jerk1
headline: ##STEP##Switch fantasy for flaws.

title: How to Spot a Player
headline: ##STEP##Watch out for over-confidence.,##STEP##Calculate the age gap.,##STEP##Glance at the phone.,##STEP##Track him down.Pay attention to the places he frequents when you're not around.,##STEP##Beware of flattery.,##STEP##Don't dismiss dishonesty.,##STEP##Consider the player's life story.,##STEP##Share your own story.,##STEP##Talk about past relationships.,##STEP##Defend your own innocence.,##STEP##Value your own time.,##STEP##Avoid hot-and-cold behavior.,##STEP##Change up your meeting place.,##STEP##Maintain eye contact.,##STEP##Move slowly.,##STEP##Take it public.,##STEP##Get to know the friends.Try to spend time with his friends.,##STEP##Introduce your own family and friends.,##STEP##Ask for opinions.,##STEP##Watch how others are treated.

title: How to Get Over Your Celebrity Crush
headline: ##STEP##Face it.,##STEP##Look at your admiration for this celebrity logically.,##STEP##Distance yourself from your crush.,##STEP##Spend a lot of time watching or listening or whatever at them.,##STEP##Find a friend or special someone you enjoy spending time with.,##STEP##You should know to back off if your celebrity crush is taken.,##STEP##If you're cheering on a celebrity who is separating/divorcing from their significant other, know that this celebrity is probably feeling pain right now, and you shouldn't be reveling.

headline: ##STEP##Write down your feelings.,##STEP##Think about other things.,##STEP##Don't think of yourself as a loser just because the person said they didn't like you or that you're too smart, too nice, etc.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Try talking to a parent, sibling or a friend about what's happened.

title: How to Get over Someone That You Know Doesn't Like You
headline: ##STEP##All this information will be if you are not particularly close or friends with the person.,##STEP##Decide first if you want to get rid of them for good.,##STEP##Cut off any contact you may have with him/her.,##STEP##Do not try to talk to them when unnecessary.,##STEP##Write a list of all their bad points.,##STEP##try to remember a time that they were not particularly nice to you or annoyed you.,##STEP##Remember, if they were not willing to make an effort with you; why should you too?,##STEP##Spend more time with friends and family.,##STEP##If you have imaginations/fantasies of this person in your mind then replace them with someone else.,##STEP##Check out other guys/girls.,##STEP##Find new interests or be more involved in activities.,##STEP##Look after yourself, you are more important than some person you barely know.

title: How to Get Over a Crush on Your Best Friend2

title: How to Get over the Crush You Have on Your Guy Friend
headline: ##STEP##Stop only thinking about him.,##STEP##Don't cling to him whenever you, your friend, and his crush are together.,##STEP##If the girl he likes is nice, try to make friends with her.,##STEP##Try not to care so much about what he thinks.,##STEP##If you have a close enough friend that's a girl, try seeking her advice.,##STEP##Try to focus on one of his flaws.,##STEP##Don't let this ruin your life!,##STEP##Do not let this crush ruin your friendship.

title: How to Get Over a Guy Who Doesn't Like You
headline: ##STEP##Release your hope for him.,##STEP##Grieve.,##STEP##Evaluate his behavior and your own.,##STEP##Remind yourself of things you didn't like about him.,##STEP##Remember that you're loveable.,##STEP##Renew yourself.,##STEP##Be healthy and take care of yourself.,##STEP##Date when you're ready.There's no need to rush it, but when dating sounds appealing to you, try it out.,##STEP##Take some distance if you can.,##STEP##Spend more time with your friends.,##STEP##Confide in your friends.,##STEP##Dismiss gossip.

title: How to Forget Your Crush
headline: ##STEP##Let your emotions out.,##STEP##Forget your anger and bitterness.,##STEP##Focus on your crush’s worst qualities.,##STEP##Know that you deserve better.,##STEP##Remember how amazing you are.,##STEP##Stop talking to your crush.,##STEP##Stop talking about your crush, too.,##STEP##Avoid your crush on social media.,##STEP##Avoid places where your crush is likely to be.,##STEP##Mix up your routine.,##STEP##Lean on your friends and family.,##STEP##Do what you love.,##STEP##Enjoy your solo time.,##STEP##Get out of the house.,##STEP##Love the single life.,##STEP##Get ready for a new crush.

title: How to Deal With Being Disappointed by Your Crush
headline: ##STEP##Try to not let yourself break down right in front of him/her.,##STEP##When you are by yourself, allow yourself to cry if you need to.,##STEP##Don't let this person bring you down because he/she is not even worth it.,##STEP##Consider the positives of the situation.,##STEP##If you see this person a lot, try not to avoid them.,##STEP##Don't totally discount the idea of being friends in the future.,##STEP##The most important thing to remember is continue to love yourself.

title: How to Answer when Your Crush Asks You a Strange Question1
headline: ##STEP##Pause.,##STEP##Smile.,##STEP##Ask for clarification.

title: How to Ask Your Crush Who He/She Likes Without Letting Him/Her Suspect Anything
headline: ##STEP##Don't be straightforward!,##STEP##Play truth or dare.,##STEP##If they say "nobody" there's a 50% chance they might be lying.,##STEP##If they look down on the floor with sad eyes, they might be shy or they are heartbroken.,##STEP##If they are startled or froze, their crush might be you!,##STEP##If they say out another people's name, then there is a 50% chance that they are making it up.,##STEP##There is a 1% chance that this would happen unless that person is straightforward.,##STEP##Start with step 1 or 2 then follow 3 onwards.

title: How to Identify an Orca
headline: ##STEP##Take Pictures Of...##STEP####STEP####STEP##Dorsal Fin##STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP## ##STEP####STEP####STEP##Saddle Patch Tail##STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP##;##STEP##,##STEP##Take Notes in Journal or Sketchbook##STEP####STEP####STEP##If you can't get a picture, sketch or note things like approximate size, Behaviors, and markings, nicks, or scars on the dorsal fin or tail.##STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Use Information for Identification##STEP####STEP##Colors and Markings:Orcas have very bold black-and-white coloring.,##STEP##Behaviors or Unique Markings:Besides having one blowhole, they are also known for coming out of the water in a certain way that is called breaching or spyhopping.,##STEP##Look at Orca Types##STEP####STEP####STEP##Five Known Types Exist (depending upon geographical location)##STEP##Resident: dorsal fins more rounded at tip, larger pods##STEP##Transient: dorsal fins more erect and elongated, smaller pods.,##STEP##CAUTION!!,##STEP##Identify an Orca##STEP####STEP##There are several sites to help identify a specific whale using the information you've collected.,##STEP##Report Sightings##STEP####STEP####STEP##BC cetacean sightings network http://wildwhales.org/sightings/##STEP####STEP##Cascadia Research http://www.cascadiaresearch.org/reporting_marine_mammal_sighting.htm##STEP####STEP####STEP##,##STEP##HAVE FUN AND ENJOY THE EXPERIENCE!##STEP####STEP##

headline: ##STEP##Walk onto the platform, with food bucket in hand for positive reinforcement.,##STEP##Walk to about 5 inches (12.7 cm) from the edge of the platform, still directly in front of the dolphin, and kneel down.,##STEP##With the dolphin still at the station, place your right hand gently on the dolphin's rostrum (nose).##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##With the hand that is on the dolphins’ rostrum, gently push towards dolphin, as if pushing the dolphin's head away from you.,##STEP##Gently grab onto its flukes and place into your lap, allowing the dolphin to relax and feel comfortable.

title: How to Pick a Cage for a Guinea Pig
headline: ##STEP##Get together enough grids for the cage; for two guinea pigs you will need a minimum of two grids wide and four grids long.,##STEP##Connect the grids to form the perimeter of the cage (12 grids/24 connectors for a two by four cage, or 14 grids/28 connectors for the preferred size cage for two guinea pigs).##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Measure and mark the Coroplast (using a tape measure, yardstick and pen).,##STEP##Cut it to the outer dimensions with the scissors or box cutter.,##STEP##Measure and mark 6" in from all sides (the inner dimensions).##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Score the Coroplast along these lines using a razor blade or box cutter.,##STEP##Cut all the way through the Coroplast at each corner, just 6" in, to create the flap to make the corner.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Snap the edges away from the score line to form a box.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Secure the flaps on the outside with clear packing tape.,##STEP##Place the box inside the connected grids.,##STEP##Add bedding, hiding areas, food dishes, water bottle, hay holders, toys, and guinea pigs.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Check that it is sturdy.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Set up the cage indoors.,For pictures to go with the instructions, visit http://guineapigcages.com/howto.htm##STEP####STEP##

headline: ##STEP##Purchase a suitable habitat.,##STEP##Place bedding into the habitat.,##STEP##Include a litter tray.,##STEP##Provide food and water.,##STEP##Place toys and an exercise wheel in the habitat.,##STEP##Consider purchasing enrichment items for outside the habitat.,##STEP##Buy bathing materials.,##STEP##Buy two of everything if you plan to buy a pair of hamsters.,##STEP##Clean the habitat once a week.,##STEP##Do not buy online.,##STEP##Go to the pet store in the late afternoon or early evening.,##STEP##Choose a young hamster.,##STEP##Look for signs of a healthy hamster.,##STEP##Make sure the pet store separates male and female hamsters.,##STEP##Request to put your hand in the hamster enclosure.,##STEP##Purchase your hamster.,##STEP##Obtain a small traveling kit.,##STEP##Bring your hamster home as quickly and safely as possible.,##STEP##Leave your new Roborovski hamster alone for the first several days.,##STEP##Ensure your hamster is awake before reaching into the habitat.,##STEP##Acclimate your hamster to your daily habitat chores.,##STEP##Allow your hamster to sniff your hand while in the habitat.,##STEP##Respect your hamster’s individual personality.,##STEP##Play with your hamster.,##STEP##Sit down when handling your hamster.,##STEP##Keep your hamster away from other household pets, such as cats and dogs.

title: How to Look After Your Syrian Hamster
headline: ##STEP##First you need to write down a list of names to call your pet hamster.The names can be anything you want Ex: Bob, Fred, Hammy, Daisy, Lilly, Honey, etc.,##STEP##Before you get your hamster you need to go to your local pet shop.,##STEP##Also the day before you get your hamster it is a good idea to make a spreadsheet like the one on the picture.,##STEP##It is best to buy your hamster in the late afternoon to the evening, because hamsters tend to be more awake by then.,##STEP##When you get the hamster it will come in a couple of boxes.,##STEP##When you get home open the box and put the hole by the cage door and let the hamster run out.,##STEP##Tame your hamster slowly by letting it get used to your hand, voice, and scent.

title: How to Tame Your Winter White Hamster
headline: ##STEP##Before you begin taming, make sure that you leave your hamster alone in their cage for at least 3-4 days after you get them.,##STEP##Dry out a bathtub completely then put down a towel/blanket in the bottom.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Get your hamster out of its cage and put him/her in the bathtub.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Start by giving treats from your hand.,##STEP##Sit in the bathtub and hide treats on your legs, on your hands, etc.,##STEP##Start to try to pet it.,##STEP##Cup your hands under the hamster and try to pick it up.,##STEP##Keep up the training gradually.

headline: ##STEP##Leave your hamster alone for a week aside from feeding when you first get it.,##STEP##Get your hamster used to your voice.,##STEP##Offer your hamster a treat.,##STEP##Put the treat on your palm once your hamster is taking it.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Lift your hand a tiny bit above the cage floor when your hamster climbs onto your hand to take the treat.,##STEP##Carefully keep your hand at a safe height above a place that the hamster won't be able to get out of and offer another treat.,##STEP##Gently stroke your hamster while it is eating the treat.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Offer your other hand for your hamster to step onto (do this once it is comfortable with being petted without a treat.

title: How to Care for Campbell's Russian Hamsters
headline: ##STEP##Purchase a suitable habitat for your hamster.,##STEP##Place fresh, safe, and clean bedding into your hamster's living space.,##STEP##Have all your supplies ready and place them inside the cage/aquarium.,##STEP##Limit the number of hamsters you keep from 1 or 2.,##STEP##Obtain a playground or a playpen if you are interested in giving your hamster a space for "out-of-tank" excursions.,##STEP##Purchase your Campbell's Russian hamster.,##STEP##Leave your hamster alone for the first 3 to 5 days.,##STEP##After 4 to 5 days, lift the light cloth from your hamster's enclosure, alert your hamster of your presence, and start the daily chores.,##STEP##Once you have successfully tamed your hamster in its main habitat, you can introduce it to its new play area.,##STEP##Clean the hamster's habitat every two to three weeks.,##STEP##Keep your hamster away from other household pets.##STEP####STEP##

title: How to Breed Syrian Hamsters
headline: ##STEP##Have a valid reason for breeding Syrian hamsters.,##STEP##Consider how you will enact your plan.,##STEP##Avoid breeding closely related hamsters.,##STEP##Buy an unrelated male and female hamster.,##STEP##Make sure that the hamsters are about the same age.,##STEP##Provide the hamsters with comfortable environments.,##STEP##Move the cages together after a week.,##STEP##Introduce the hamsters when they come of age.,##STEP##Determine whether the female is in heat.,##STEP##Do not place the hamsters together when the female is not in heat.,##STEP##Place the hamsters in the same cage when the female is in heat.,##STEP##Supervise the mating process.,##STEP##Separate them when they're finished.,##STEP##Make a record of the date.,##STEP##Observe the female for a week.,##STEP##Figure out when she will give birth.,##STEP##Watch for physical changes in the female.,##STEP##Provide her with nesting and bedding materials.,##STEP##Prepare the cage for the birth and babies.,##STEP##Do not handle the hamster close to her due date.,##STEP##Don't disturb the new mother or her babies.,##STEP##Continue to care for her after the delivery.,##STEP##Begin feeding the babies about one week after birth.,##STEP##Check for healthy development in the babies.,##STEP##Clean the cage at two weeks.,##STEP##Adjust the cage for the babies.,##STEP##Check the babies’ two-week development.,##STEP##Determine the babies' genders at around 3.5 to 4 weeks.,##STEP##Separate the males and females once you determine the genders.,##STEP##Double check the babies' genders.,##STEP##Get the babies used to human handling.,##STEP##Line up customers early.,##STEP##Sell the hamsters.,##STEP##Separate females after 2-3 months of age.

title: How to Care For a Mother Hamster and Her Babies
headline: ##STEP##Prepare the mother for birth.,##STEP##Scatter food for the mother to bring the babies.,##STEP##Check the cage frequently.,##STEP##Avoid touching the babies until they've grown fur.,##STEP##Encourage naturally weaning by providing an adequate supply of food.,##STEP##Separate baby hamsters from their mother after 21 to 28 days.,##STEP##Determine the sex of the babies.,##STEP##Make sure there's enough food and water.,##STEP##Keep the cage dry.,##STEP##Refrain from cleaning the cage early on.

title: How to Care for Newborn Hamsters2
headline: ##STEP##Interfere very little for the first week.,##STEP##Understand how the babies will develop.Hamster babies are born incredibly vulnerable — furless, deaf, blind, and with their limbs are only partially developed.,##STEP##Let the mother care for her babies.,##STEP##Make sure the mother is well-fed.In the first couple weeks, when the babies get all their nutrition from the mother, it's important that the mother is well-fed and healthy.,##STEP##Provide food and water for the babies.,##STEP##Separate the hamsters by sex at the appropriate age.Syrian hamsters must be segregated by sex at 3-4 weeks, at which age they will begin to fight.

title: How to Care for Newborn Hamsters3
headline: ##STEP##Understand the risks.,##STEP##Be very careful using a surrogate mother.Though natural hamster milk is the best source of nutrition for developing babies, hamsters are not very well-suited to surrogacy.,##STEP##Replace the mother's milk as best as possible.,##STEP##Use an eyedropper to feed them.Suck some Lactol up in the eyedropper, then squeeze it so a drip hovers on the end of the pipette.,##STEP##Regulate the temperature for them.Hamsters are born furless, so until they're about 10 days old, they cannot regulate their own body temperature.

title: How to Train Your Hamster to Come when You Call
headline: ##STEP##Make sure that your hamster is familiar with your scent and voice.,##STEP##Get a sunflower seed or any other delicious treat that you know your hamster likes.,##STEP##Move your end at the end of your hamster's cage, opposite of where it is sitting.,##STEP##When your hamster comes to your hand, let it take the treat and eat it.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Repeat the above steps several times.,##STEP##After the hamster comes to your hand several times in a row, repeat steps above, except without the treat.,##STEP##Wash your hands to remove any germs or odors that may hurt or scare your hamster.,##STEP##Place a treat in the palm of your hand.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Hold your hand at the end of the cage, opposite of where your hamster is sitting.,##STEP##As the hamster comes towards you for the treat, repeat its name several times in a slow and clear manner.,##STEP##Repeat the steps above, but move the treat a little farther from your hamster each time.,##STEP##Soon, you can start calling it towards you without a treat.

title: How to Train Your Hamster
headline: ##STEP##When you bring your hamster home, leave it alone for a couple of days.,##STEP##Get your hamster used to the sound of your voice.,##STEP##Provide digging opportunities.,##STEP##Put a sunflower seed or a hamster treat in your hand.,##STEP##Teach your hamster some tricks.,##STEP##Do the same thing with other tricks like "paw".,##STEP##For "turn" or "roll over," put the treat on its backside.,##STEP##Train your hamster about what not to do.,##STEP##Teach your hamster how to jump.,##STEP##Teach your hamster to climb up your shoulder.,##STEP##Use the "find" trick.,##STEP##Try giving the hamster a carrot as a treat.

headline: ##STEP##Choose the right size rope.,##STEP##Set up the tightrope.Tie a rope between two solid, heavy objects.,##STEP##Place a layer of soft bedding below the tightrope.Even though you’re placing the rope at a low elevation, it’s best to be extra cautious to prevent your mouse from suffering an injury.,##STEP##Ensure your pet will not escape.

title: How to Teach a Hamster Tricks
headline: ##STEP##Build a good relationship with your hamster.,##STEP##Know your hamster.,##STEP##Be ready to have many days of training and patience ahead of you.,##STEP##Now you're ready for the Circle Trick.,##STEP##Repeat.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Repeat again.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Repeat for a few days.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##The next step for the Circle Trick is to hold the treat above the hamster's head and say the training word(s).,##STEP##Another trick is the Hoop trick.,##STEP##It will take a while before your hamster realizes that to get the treat, it has to go THROUGH the hoop, not just struggle until it gets the treat.,##STEP##Repeat until your hamster is a pro!##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Another trick that isn't really a trick is the Finger trick.,##STEP##Tap your finger in a place wherever you want.,##STEP##Repeat until your are satisfied.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##So now you know a few basic tricks!

title: How to Prevent Bladder Stones in Guinea Pigs
headline: ##STEP##Keep your guinea pig on clean, dry bedding.,##STEP##Feed your guinea pig a low or reduced calcium diet.,##STEP##Give your pig a variety of reduced calcium foods.,##STEP##Encourage your guinea pig to drink plenty of water.,##STEP##Check if your guinea pig has parents with a history of bladder stones.,##STEP##Pay attention to your guinea pig’s urine for any blood.,##STEP##Notice if your pig squeals when he tries to pee or spends a lot of time squatting.,##STEP##Check to see if you guinea pig has stopped eating or has lost weight.,##STEP##Change your guinea pig’s diet.,##STEP##Get your pig’s urine checked for a urinary tract infection.Typical guinea pig urine is alkaline with a pH of 8.5, but if the pH of their urine changes, this can lead to the deposition of certain minerals.,##STEP##Consider surgical removal of the stones.,##STEP##Make the difficult decision to euthanize your guinea pig.

title: How to Look After Your Sick Guinea Pig
headline: ##STEP##Let the vet examine your guinea pig as soon as they become ill. headline: ##STEP##Bring him or her home in a cat carrier filled with a blanket or a cardboard box also filled with a blanket on the bottom.,##STEP##You will need to clean the cage thoroughly to remove bacteria.,##STEP##To fill the cage you'll need either white fleece blankets or vet bed.,##STEP##Put some SOFT hay in the bed, if you use hay that's quite long strings and is a bit hard or straw like, use a good quality meadow hay, it tends to be smaller pieces and thinner and softer.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##You'll need to check your guinea pig 2 times a day, morning, evening and before bed, to check his or her stitches are still okay.,##STEP##Feed high vitamin C vegetables like red pepper, mustard spinach and kale as a healthy guinea pig is essential when in the aftercare process.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##If you have a male and you're housing it with a female, do not place him with her for 3 months, as there still can be a small amount of sperm around which can get out - seems unlikely but very true, and only 1 sperm cell is needed to impregnate a female.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Caring for the guinea pig using vet bed should only last about 2-3 weeks.

title: How to Care for a Guinea Pig with a Long Term Injury
headline: ##STEP##Get a vet-advised painkiller for your pet.,##STEP##Get small, thin syringes that you can fill with water and keep a bowl handy.,##STEP##Dissolve kibble pellets in water, making a sort of "mush".,##STEP##If relevant, ice the inflicted part of your pet.,##STEP##If your guinea pig has a cagemate, keep the cagemate out of the injured pet's way.,##STEP##Get a pet bed.,##STEP##Remove waste from around the pet.

title: How to Diagnose Gastrointestinal Problems in Guinea Pigs
headline: ##STEP##Detect a bloated abdomen.,##STEP##Examine your guinea pig’s mouth.,##STEP##Check your guinea pig’s hind end for fecal staining.,##STEP##Observe your guinea pig’s posture.,##STEP##Look at your guinea pig’s fur.,##STEP##Notice changes in pooping behavior.,##STEP##Detect a decreased appetite.,##STEP##Determine if your guinea pig has less energy.,##STEP##Observe teeth grinding.,##STEP##Take your guinea pig to your vet right away.,##STEP##Allow your vet to examine your guinea pig.,##STEP##Have your vet analyze your guinea pig’s blood and urine.,##STEP##Allow your vet to take x-rays of your guinea pig.

title: How to Care for a Pregnant Guinea Pig
headline: ##STEP##Look for symptoms of pregnancy.,##STEP##Have the pregnancy diagnosed by a vet.,##STEP##If the pregnancy is unexpected, determine where the sow became pregnant from.,##STEP##Determine if the sow’s age makes it a high risk pregnancy.,##STEP##Determine if the sow’s body condition makes it a high risk pregnancy.,##STEP##Determine if the sow’s or boar’s breed makes the pups more vulnerable to hereditary disease.,##STEP##Pregnant guinea pigs are particularly vulnerable to illness as a result of stress during pregnancy.,##STEP##Monitor her eating and drinking habits.,##STEP##Give the sow a thorough check over twice a week.,##STEP##Limit grooming during pregnancy.,##STEP##Continue to exercise the sow.,##STEP##Ensure you are providing adequate housing.,##STEP##Remove any boars.,##STEP##Remove other sows if you need to.,##STEP##Clean the housing regularly.,##STEP##Create a comfortable space.,##STEP##Provide extruded pelleted feed.,##STEP##Provide clean water at all times.,##STEP##Provide quality hay.,##STEP##Offer fresh vegetables every day.,##STEP##Ensure you’re providing enough vitamins and minerals.,##STEP##Increase the amount of fruit you provide in the last 4weeks of pregnancy.,##STEP##Make sure you have everything you need for the birth.,##STEP##Know that it is incredibly difficult to tell when a guinea pig will give birth.,##STEP##From 60 days, check on the sow several times a day.,##STEP##Pregnancy toxemia and calcium deficiency are most common in the last seven – 10 days before the birth.,##STEP##Listen closely.,##STEP##Be present for the birth.,##STEP##During the birth, look out for signs of complications and be ready to call the vet if need be.,##STEP##Intervene yourself with the pups only when absolutely necessary.,##STEP##Check each pup is breathing.,##STEP##Check that the sow clears away any signs of the birth.,##STEP##Ensure that the sow is interested in the pups as first-time mothers, particularly young ones, may run away from the pups as if confused.,##STEP##Expect that the pups are born alert and ‘ready to run’ as miniature versions of adult guinea pigs.,##STEP##Leave the mother and pups alone for a couple of hours.,##STEP##Weigh the pups and mother the same day as the birth.,##STEP##Weigh the pups and mother again the next day.,##STEP##Continue to weigh the pups and mother daily.,##STEP##Get the vet to check the mother and all of the pups.,##STEP##Continue to provide the enhanced diet.,##STEP##At three to five weeks, the males become sexually mature, so sex the pups and separate them at this age.,##STEP##The pups will be weaned at 21 days.,##STEP##Reintroduce any sows you may have removed to the female pups at three to four weeks.,##STEP##Realise how easily guinea pigs can become pregnant.,##STEP##Separate guinea pigs into same-sex groups.,##STEP##Neuter male guinea pigs.,##STEP##Avoid deliberately breeding your guinea pig.

title: How to Determine the Sex of a Guinea Pig
headline: ##STEP##Do not examine cavies who are younger than three weeks old.,##STEP##Wear medical gloves.,##STEP##Perform the exam on a low, stable service.,##STEP##Hold the guinea pig gently but firmly.,##STEP##Check the distance between the guinea pig’s anus and genitals.,##STEP##Examine the shape of the cavy’s genital opening.,##STEP##Press just above the genital opening to check for a penis.,##STEP##Have a licensed vet confirm the guinea pig’s sex if you are unsure.

headline: ##STEP##Make sure your guinea pig has its own space.,##STEP##Keep things quiet for your guinea pig.Guinea pigs have sensitive hearing, so they’ll be most comfortable in a place that is free from major sources of noise (such as traffic, loud televisions, and rambunctious play).,##STEP##Leave your guinea pig alone at first.,##STEP##Feed your guinea pig at the same time each day.Having a regular supply of food will keep your guinea pig healthy and happy.,##STEP##Make sure your guinea pig is eating.,##STEP##Talk to your guinea pig.,##STEP##Let your guinea pig sniff your hand.,##STEP##Try picking your guinea pig up.,##STEP##Feed your guinea pig lots of treats.,##STEP##Give your indoor guinea pig some play time.,##STEP##Find some bonding activities.

title: How to Raise Hamsters
headline: ##STEP##It is best to get a young hamster so that it will get used to you easily: One around 5-7 weeks old is best.,##STEP##Once you have your hamster, no matter the age, leave it in its cage with the following: food dish, water bottle, exercise wheel and toys.,##STEP##Every day talk to it gently and, after the second day, while it's not sleeping or eating, let it sniff your hand, then pick it up gently and put it on the floor.,##STEP##Feed and give water to your hamster daily.,##STEP##Take a piece of celery, apple or cucumber and put it near your hamster.,##STEP##The next day, try to let the hamster eat the celery from your hand.,##STEP##Once it eats from your hand, hold it and stroke it every day.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Your hamster will learn to love you very quickly.##STEP####STEP##

title: How to Wake up Your Hamster Without Scaring It3
headline: ##STEP##Understand that hamsters are “crepuscular.” Hamsters are commonly (though mistakenly) called “nocturnal,” when in fact they are “crepuscular.” Whereas nocturnal animals are most active at night, your hamster will be most active during twilight hours (dusk and dawn).,##STEP##Track your hamster’s schedule.,##STEP##Feed him at the same time each day.,##STEP##Begin moving your feeding time back.,##STEP##Be patient.

headline: ##STEP####STEP##Tell them what food your hamster eats, what foods it likes and dislikes, or any medication it might need.##STEP##,##STEP####STEP##Explain that they need to clean the cage weekly and change the food and water everyday.,##STEP####STEP##Show them how to properly hold the hamster and tell them that they need to play with it everyday and let it out!##STEP##,##STEP####STEP##Make sure they know all the rules about other household pets.##STEP##,##STEP####STEP##If you have rules about what your hamster can and can't do when your friends are around, make sure that they know those rules.##STEP##,##STEP####STEP##Make sure it is someone you absolutely trust and that they have a lot of time to make sure they don't forget your hamster (don't ask someone who doesn't have a very good memory)!##STEP##,##STEP####STEP##Give them a way to contact you if something happens.

title: How to Teach Your Cat to Do Tricks
headline: ##STEP##Get a supply of treats.,##STEP##Get your cat’s attention.,##STEP##Use a clicker.,##STEP##Keep training sessions short and frequent.,##STEP##Repeat tricks when training your cat.,##STEP##Don’t use cue words until after the cat has learned a trick.,##STEP##Teach one trick at a time.,##STEP##Do not punish your cat for not learning a trick.,##STEP##Teach your cat to sit.,##STEP##Teach your cat to “hi-five.” First, encourage your cat to move its paw by giving it a treat each time it lifts the paw off of the ground.,##STEP##Train your cat to come when called.Try this training your cat for this trick at is mealtimes, because it will already be hungry.,##STEP##Train your cat to touch an object.You can have your cat learn to touch an object like a toy or a sturdy surface that will not fall over.,##STEP##Train your cat to sit up on two legs.Hold a treat above your cat, but not so close that it can touch it.,##STEP##Teach your cat to shake hands.Sit in front of your cat and gently touch its paw.,##STEP##Train your cat to meow on command.

title: How to Teach a Cat to "High Five"2
headline: ##STEP##Sit on the floor facing your cat, with a bowl or dish between you.,##STEP##Present a treat to your cat at about shoulder height while saying “high five.” If you cat goes for the treat with its mouth, or does nothing, withdraw your hand and treat, wait five seconds, then try again.,##STEP##“Click + treat” as soon as your cat extends a paw in any manner toward you or the treat.,##STEP##Repeat the process until your cat only uses its paw to reach the treat.,##STEP##Begin to reward your cat only when it makes contact with your hand.,##STEP##Remove the treat from the process once your cat consistently reaches with a paw.,##STEP##Switch your hand into a “high five” position, palm facing the cat at about eye level.,##STEP##Start practicing from different angles once your cat masters the motion.

title: How to Teach a Cat to "High Five"3
headline: ##STEP##Sit on the floor facing your cat.,##STEP##Hold the target above the cat’s head, out of reach of its mouth and nose.,##STEP##“Click+treat” any movement of a paw at first.,##STEP##Begin to inch your hand towards the tip of the target.,##STEP##Replace the target with just your hand.,##STEP##Add a verbal cue while the cat is reaching out its paw.,##STEP##Move your hand positioning down incrementally so that your palm faces the cat at about eye level.

title: How to Teach a Cat to "High Five"4
headline: ##STEP##Prepare for the session.,##STEP##Provide one treat off the saucer, then withdraw the plate to the table.,##STEP##Stop the session when the treats are all gone or the cat loses interest.,##STEP##Begin to reward only more significant paw movements.,##STEP##Start to place your hand in the way of the cat’s paw as it comes back down.,##STEP##Raise your hand a little with each attempt towards the point where your cat is reaching its paw.,##STEP##Keep raising your hand higher and begin to rotate it to a horizontal position (palm facing to the side).,##STEP##Rotate your hand into the traditional “high five” position, with your fingers up and palm facing the cat.,##STEP##Continue the training.

title: How to Teach Your Cat to Kiss1
headline: ##STEP##Make sure your cat is hungry.,##STEP##Ask a friend to sit a few feet away from the cat.,##STEP##Apply some cat food on your friend’s cheek.,##STEP##Let the cat go to your friend.,##STEP##Say the command “Kiss!” You should time this so that the cat is “kissing” (licking) your friend’s face at the same time that you give the “kiss” command.,##STEP##Repeat this process a number of times.

title: How to Train a Cat to Jump Through a Hoop1
headline: ##STEP##Acquire everything listed below in the "Things you'll need" section.,##STEP##Begin with your cat on the floor, hoop in one hand (at this stage the hoop should be touching floor and always vertical) touching the floor, treat visible in the other.,##STEP##Hold the hoop between your cat and the hand with the treat in it.,##STEP##Repeat this step until your cats has it down.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Raise the hoop about an inch or two.,##STEP##Keep raising the hoop and continue to make it more challenging.,##STEP##Your cat should now expect a treat every time s/he goes through.

title: How to Teach Your Cat to Jump Through Your Arms
headline: ##STEP##Praise your cat!,##STEP##Start with a semi-hungry cat.,##STEP##Spread your legs and bend your knees slightly.,##STEP##Make a hoop with your arms and place it on the floor, allowing your cat to walk through the hoop and eat its food.,##STEP##That's it for this meal.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Repeat.,##STEP##Lift your arm hoop off the ground.,##STEP##That's it!

title: How to Train a Bird and a Cat to Live Together
headline: ##STEP##Bring the cat in front of the bird's cage (with the bird inside of it).,##STEP##Place the cat on the ground; it is recommended that you leash the cat, so that it won't run away.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Stand closely behind, with a spray bottle filled with water.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Observe the cat and be ready to react.,##STEP##Continue doing this until your cat does not lunge/attack at the bird.,##STEP##Keep the cat on the leash, while you bring the bird.,##STEP##Be ready to react.,##STEP##Continue until the cat does not try to attack.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Keep trying this for a week.,##STEP##Be present at all times when the cat and bird are together.

headline: ##STEP##Isolate the new pet in a safe space.,##STEP##Introduce the scent first.,##STEP##Learn to recognize the signs of arousal, which is the stage before aggression.,##STEP##Let the pets see and smell each other.,##STEP##Let the pets be in the room together.,##STEP##Try to always end on a positive note in an interaction.,##STEP##Be patient.,##STEP##Use positive reinforcement.,##STEP##Provide a perch for your cat.,##STEP##Don't force interactions.,##STEP##Try not to leave your pets alone together, before they're socialized.,##STEP##Don't declaw the cat.,##STEP##Make sure your animals get breaks from each other.

title: How to Socialize Your Kitten
headline: ##STEP##Start handling the kitten from 10-14 days old.,##STEP##Distract an anxious mother with some food.,##STEP##Gently hold and stroke the kitten.,##STEP##After four weeks, start playing with the kitten.,##STEP##Hold the kitten for at least 15 minutes a day.,##STEP##Enlist your friends to play with the kitten.,##STEP##Try to expose the kitten to as many different experiences as possible.,##STEP##Know what not to do.,##STEP##Remember that hand-reared kittens also need to be socialized with other cats.,##STEP##Understand the difficulty with socializing kittens over 7 weeks old.,##STEP##Be patient and persistent when socializing abused kittens/cats.,##STEP##Play with younger cats to build their confidence.,##STEP##Use food to gain the cat's trust.,##STEP##Familiarize yourself with the development of newborn kittens.,##STEP##Understand the importance of the socialization period.,##STEP##Be aware of how short the socialization period is.

title: How to Make a Cat and Dog Get Along
headline: ##STEP##Prepare for the introduction.,##STEP##Go slow.,##STEP##Alternate the rooms you keep the animals in.,##STEP##Let the cat and dog smell each other under the door dividing them.This will help them associate the new smells they are smelling with a specific animal, even if they can't actually see it.,##STEP##Wait to introduce your cat and dog until the cat seems relaxed and ready.If the cat is frightened and runs and hides whenever the dog gets near the door to their room, you need to give the cat more time.,##STEP##Hold your cat in your arms until it is calm and relaxed.,##STEP##Show your pets equal amounts of love as you introduce them to each other.,##STEP##Separate your pets once again.,##STEP##Continue to have your dog and cat interact until they are relaxed in each other's presence.,##STEP##Separate your pets when you are not home or with them.,##STEP##Redirect negative behaviors that your dog directs at your cat.,##STEP##Reward and praise your dog for good behavior around the cat.,##STEP##Provide your cat with a place where it can always get out of reach of your dog.,##STEP##Have realistic expectations.

title: How to Keep a Dog or Cat Successfully While Living in an Apartment
headline: ##STEP##Choose your pet based on the challenges of apartment living.,##STEP##Consider the extra costs some apartment communities charge pet owners.,##STEP##Acknowledge that your dog or cat might damage or destroy something in the apartment, and be prepared to pay for it.,##STEP##Realize the spatial challenges that apartment living will present for owning a pet.,##STEP##Think about how small things like walking your dog might become huge chores.,##STEP##Have your pet neutered or spayed.,##STEP##Be a considerate neighbor when it comes to noise.,##STEP##Clear your pet with the landlord before you move in or bring home a new pet.,##STEP##Be prepared to present your landlord with a vet reference and associated documentation.,##STEP##Clean up after your dog.,##STEP##Clean up after your cat.,##STEP##Avoid letting your pet roam the neighborhood.,##STEP##Socialize your dog or cat.,##STEP##Establish regular outdoor break-times for your dog to go to the bathroom.,##STEP##Create a pet nest area and/or animal haven.,##STEP##Schedule regular times for your pet to exercise and release pent-up energy.,##STEP##Keep clean litter all the time.,##STEP##House train your dog.,##STEP##Brush your dog or cat often - outside.,##STEP##Provide your pet with plenty of toys.,##STEP##Avoid feeding your pet people food.,##STEP##Make regular visits to the vet and keep up immunizations.,##STEP##Vacuum often.,##STEP##Use a placemat under your pet's water and food bowls.,##STEP##Dust your home often.,##STEP##Use rugs or doormats at any entrances.

headline: ##STEP##Preferably, introduce the cat and the animal(s) who will be living together.,##STEP##Exercise caution during the first encounter.,##STEP##Let them sniff each other.,##STEP##After about a week of introductions, determine whether or not it's safe to let them frolic freely in an enclosed area.,##STEP##In the case where the two animals do not get along, progress with another week's worth of introductions, then try again.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##If all goes well, you will be able to have no worries about your cat killing your bird or any other delicate animals.##STEP####STEP##

headline: ##STEP##Use a carrier in good working order.,##STEP##Put the carrier out a few days before the move.,##STEP##Make the carrier smell like home.,##STEP##Consider using medication to calm the cat for the move.,##STEP##Consider closing the cat into a room during the move.,##STEP##Try a test run.,##STEP##Don't feed the cat before putting them in the carrier.,##STEP##Keep each day of a drive to eight hours or less.,##STEP##Give the cat the chance to use the litter box before leaving.,##STEP##Put the cat in the carrier and don't take the cat out once you've arrived.,##STEP##Keep the car cool and quiet.,##STEP##Cat-proof the house.,##STEP##Let your cat into one small room.,##STEP##Show the cat the litter box location.,##STEP##Put familiar items out.,##STEP##Let cats explore at their own pace.,##STEP##Try to keep your cat's daily routine as stable as possible.

title: How to Care for a Cat when You Have a Pet Rodent As Well
headline: ##STEP##Know which rodents cats possibly may eat.,##STEP##If you got your cat before the rodent, make sure you buy a strong cage and medication for the rodent, just in case the cat gets it sick.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##If you got the rodent before the cat, be ready to distract the cat with lots of cat toys and other things.,##STEP##Make sure your cat can't put its claws or paws through the wires of the rodent's cage.,##STEP##Get bedding that won't stick out of the cage easily.,##STEP##Make sure your rodent doesn't have rabies or other diseases.,##STEP##Move the rodent's cage every time your cat is not looking if it usually gets very close to the rodent.,##STEP##Let someone that is trusted or a family member watch your two pets while you are gone.,##STEP##Distract your cat with toys or teach it to do some tricks for a while.,##STEP##As soon as your cat wants to seem to eat your rodent, feed it if it has not been fed yet.,##STEP##Whenever your cat doesn't pay attention to the rodent, give it a treat.

headline: ##STEP##Buy an onion.,##STEP##Cut the onion in half.,##STEP##Place the two onion halves in the room with the litter box.,##STEP##Expect the onion fumes to dissipate.,##STEP##Remove the onions when the litter-box smell returns.,##STEP##Do not allow your cats near the onion halves.,##STEP##Hide the onion halves.,##STEP##Put a colander or other perforated object over the onion half.,##STEP##Closely watch your cat.,##STEP##Have enough litter boxes in your house.,##STEP##Locate the box strategically.,##STEP##Change the litter at least every other day.

title: How to Tame a Feral Kitten
headline: ##STEP##Put the kitten(s) in a carrier or small room away from other animals.,##STEP##Make sure the kitten has food, water, cat litter, and blankets.,##STEP##Don't touch the new kitten for at least 24 hours.,##STEP##Don't try to touch the kitten if it is hissing or spitting at you.,##STEP##Sit in the area the kitten is in or by the cage.,##STEP##Start playing with the kitten using string or lasers.,##STEP##Start feeding the kitten a little bit of wet food with you in the room or by the cage.,##STEP##Start petting the kitten while it's playing or eating.,##STEP##Move the kitten into your bedroom.,##STEP##Keep petting the kitten while playing and feeding.,##STEP##By this time your kitten should be okay with you petting it.,##STEP##After the kitten gets used to being picked up, bring in other family members or friends to pet and play with the kitten.,##STEP##If the kitten is okay with all of that, she or he is ready to be brought to the vet for shots and a check up.,##STEP##If the kitten is healthy you may introduce to other pets or adopt out.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Give it food.

title: How to Put on a Horse's/Pony's Rug
headline: ##STEP##Put on the head-collar and tie the lead rope to a piece of string for safety.,##STEP##Retrieve your rug, and have it in hand make sure you have a size rug that fits your horse/pony.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Fold the rug in half and, slowly and gently, lay it over the horse's/pony's back.,##STEP##Unfold the rug.,##STEP##Fasten the breast straps.,##STEP##Fasten the surcingles-these cross over the ponies belly.,##STEP##If you have a horse, fasten the leg straps.,##STEP##If you have a pony rug, then skip the previous step.,##STEP##You are now ready to turn your horse/pony out.##STEP####STEP##

title: How to Harness a Horse1
headline: ##STEP##Find the harness parts.,##STEP##Bridle the horse.,##STEP##Put the breast strap or collar on the horse.,##STEP##Place the saddle on the horse just under the withers.,##STEP##Place the harness breeching on the horse's back.,##STEP##Bring the carriage up behind the horse.,##STEP##Attach the harness traces to the tree of the carriage.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Attach the breeching to the carriage by running the hold back straps through the rings on the shafts.,##STEP##Run the reins from the carriage through the rein guides to the bit and buckle.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Walk the horse a few steps, tighten the girth, and recheck all straps and buckles for proper fitting.##STEP####STEP##

title: How to Harness a Horse2
headline: ##STEP##Harness a single horse from the front first.,##STEP##To correctly fit the winkers (bridle), the horse’s eye should be in the centre of the winker blind, this should not be pressed close against the eye.,##STEP##Consider use of the bits.,##STEP##Use open bridles.,##STEP##Place the breast collar sitting above the point of the horse’s shoulder, to allow freedom of movement, and below the windpipe, for your horse’s comfort.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Let the saddle sit behind the wither.,##STEP##Carefully fit the crupper under the tail.,##STEP##Reach the breeching seat around behind the horse from stifle to stifle.,##STEP##Adjust as required.,##STEP##Harnessing to the single carriage, reins held in the crook of your elbow, bring up the carriage.,##STEP##Slide the shafts into the tugs.,##STEP##Hold the reins as you walk around behind the carriage to get to the other side if you do not have a groom to assist you.,##STEP##Check again.,##STEP##To unharness reverse the order; loosen belly band, undo breeching straps and then traces off last.

title: How to Make a Haynet
headline: ##STEP##Tie the ends of 10 lengths together (or more for a bigger net, but make it an even number) of 7 feet (2.1 m) long strings.,##STEP##You should ask someone to hold the net up by the knot or nail the knot up or you'll get very confused and the string will get very tangled.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Measure 4 inches (10.2 cm) down (or less for a smaller-holed net) and mark with a felt-tip pen.,##STEP##Mark 4 inches (10.2 cm) down again from the row of knots that you just tied.,##STEP##Mark, pair, tie and continue this for each row.,##STEP##Make sure you have 2–4 inches (5.1–10.2 cm) of string left after your last mark, when you get to your last row.,##STEP##Thread a strong plastic drawstring through the loops.,##STEP##Finished.

headline: ##STEP##Determine how much shelter you need.,##STEP##Consider the size of your herd.,##STEP##Create stalls.,##STEP##Don't forget a fence.,##STEP##Include climbing areas.,##STEP##Buy at least two goats.,##STEP##Allow your goat to graze.,##STEP##Try alfalfa hay.,##STEP##Supplement their diet with grains.,##STEP##Provide a plentiful supply of water.,##STEP##Brush your goat once a day.,##STEP##Bathe your goats only if they get parasites.,##STEP##Provide vitamin A. Pygmy goats need vitamin A in their diets to keep up their health.,##STEP##Include vitamin D. Just like in humans, vitamin D helps goats absorb calcium, which maintains bone health.,##STEP##Add minerals for pasture-fed goats.,##STEP##Inject selenium.,##STEP##Give vaccinations yearly.Your goat will need to be vaccinated against enterotoxemia and tetanus, at the very least.,##STEP##Schedule a yearly checkup.,##STEP##Trim your goats' hooves.
