title: How to Load a Frightened Horse Into a Horse Trailer2
headline: ##STEP##Find a treat your horse loves.,##STEP##Let your horse get a good whiff of your treat of choice, then place said treat into the trailer.,##STEP##If you choose to put the treat into the trailer, make sure to keep a handful or pocketful of it to feed to your horse as s/he loads, as praise for doing the right thing.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##If your horse properly loads, let him/her have the rest of the treat as a reward, then leave him/her in there after closing the trailer for a few minutes.,##STEP##Unload your horse and give him/her a good pat on the neck.,##STEP##If you want to try this exercise again, try only having treats when they properly load or only after they have successfully loaded and unloaded.

title: How to Load a Frightened Horse Into a Horse Trailer3
headline: ##STEP##Know that you can't just expect your horse to do what you tell them when you tell them if the result is often negative.,##STEP##Walk into the trailer and ask your horse to follow.,##STEP##Praise each step forward.,##STEP##If your horse successfully loads, make sure to tie him/her up and close the trailer, so that they do not automatically equate loading with getting out.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##If you wish to try this exercise again, give your horse a few minutes before reloading.

title: How to Work With Bees
headline: ##STEP##Wear beekeeping apparel to protect yourself from stings.,##STEP##Choose a sunny day around mid-day to work the bees.,##STEP##Obtain a 5 gallon (18.9 L) bucket to place your bee working tools in.,##STEP##Fill your smoker with your chosen burning material.,##STEP##Light the smoker just before you reach the hive.##STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Approach the hive from the back, out of the landing path of the heavily laden bees.,##STEP##Open the top of the hive, and blow smoke into the inner cover.,##STEP##Pull out the frame closest to the side of the bee box, and lay it on the ground.,##STEP##Move downward into the brood box.,##STEP##Remove honey-loaded supers, and replace with a fresh super and frames.,##STEP##If you choose to do so, feed and/or medicate the bees as needed.##STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Replace all hive components, and quietly leave the area.##STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Clean all hive tools with disinfectant.##STEP####STEP##

title: How to Show a Miniature Horse
headline: ##STEP##Look at the requirements for the show.,##STEP##Make sure your miniature horse is healthy.,##STEP##Make sure your mini horse listens well, the judges will pay very close attention to the way it obeys you.,##STEP##Get the right equipment.,##STEP##Call your farrier or vet and get your mini horse’s hooves trimmed.,##STEP##When preparing for the show you need to trim your mini horse’s mane and tail.,##STEP##The morning before the show you will need to bathe your mini horse.,##STEP##Brush your horse.,##STEP##Before you go out into the ring you need to do last minute touch ups.,##STEP##When you go out you will walk around the ring one way with your mini horse until the judge tells you to go the other way.

title: How to Inspect a Beehive
headline: ##STEP##Remove the outer cover of the hive and place upside down on the ground.##STEP##,Remove empty hive body and place on outer cover.,Gently pry apart inner cover off  with the hive tool.,Lift inner cover a couple of inches and puff in some smoke with the smoker.,Close the inner corner again for a couple seconds, then remove it.,Gently pry honey supers apart with hive tool and puff smoke between them.,Remove honey supers one at a time and stack them on the outer cover.,When you get to the queen excluder, remove it and place it upside down on the honey supers.,Pry brood chambers apart and place upper chamber on excluder behind hive.,Begin inspecting bottom chamber.,Push all the frames to one side by using your hive tool and bracing it against the side of the first frame.,Insert hive tool between frames #1 and #2 and pry them apart.,Begin inspecting frames, starting with frame #2 to avoid rolling bees.,Hold frame by its top corners, over the hive body.,Inspect both sides of frame, making a mental note of queen presence and quality, and amounts of pollen, sealed and unsealed brood, and signs of disease.,Repeat with all frames in bottom chamber, then inspect upper chamber.,Reassemble the brood chamber, using the hive tool to push frames #3-#10 to one side, and place frame #2 between #1 and #3.,##STEP##Restack all hive bodies and covers, and smoke the bottom of each body before placing it on the hive.,Replace outer cover and weigh it down with a brick or something similarly heavy.

headline: ##STEP##Let your neighbors know about your cat.,##STEP##Mark the cat’s boundaries.,##STEP##Have a spray bottle handy.,##STEP##Set aside three days for initial training.,##STEP##Take your cat outside on a leash.,##STEP##Allow him to walk around.,##STEP##Avoid dragging your cat by the leash.,##STEP##Reward your cat for coming towards you or the house.,##STEP##Keep the first sessions short.,##STEP##Work up to letting the cat roam more freely.,##STEP##Watch closely.,##STEP##Encourage him to come inside on his own.,##STEP##Be persistent.,##STEP##Make sure that your cat is trained to stay in the yard.,##STEP##Encourage your cat to go out when traffic is light.,##STEP##Leave the front door open while he is out.,##STEP##Hide and wait for a car to come along.,##STEP##Spray the cat.,##STEP##Reward your cat.,##STEP##Be a role model.,##STEP##Repeat the procedure.,##STEP##Understand that not all cats are good candidates for outdoor training.,##STEP##Be aware of predatory animals.,##STEP##Find the optimal time to take your cat outdoors.,##STEP##Be patient.

title: How to Teach Your Cat to Put Its Toys Away
headline: ##STEP##Keep in mind that positive reinforcement is the most powerful tool you have when training animals.,##STEP##Gather up your cat, the bin you want her to put her toys in (this can be an old shoebox, plastic container, etc), and several of her favorite toys in a room.,##STEP##Teach your cat to hold a toy in her mouth and carry it.,##STEP##After your cat can take a few steps while carrying the toy, have her take three or more steps carrying the toy before praising her.,##STEP##Once your cat will carry the toy around on her own, encourage her to take it towards the toy bin.,##STEP##When your cat is good at doing this, encourage her to carry the toy up to the toy box using the same method as described above.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##When your cat is to the point that she will hold the toy over the toy basket, encourage her to drop the toy by gently removing it from her mouth while saying "Drop" or "Release", or by giving her a treat, which will cause her to drop the toy in the toy bin so she can eat the treat.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Gradually work towards getting your cat to drop the toy in the toy bin by praising her when she does well, ignoring her mistakes when she makes them, and helping her understand that the command "Clean Up" means take the toy to the toy bin, and "Drop" means put it in the toy bin.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Eventually, your cat will begin doing this behavior without prompting, and you will be able to get your cat to put a toy away by saying your chosen command for this action.##STEP####STEP##

title: How to Make a Cat Hammock
headline: ##STEP##Cut the fleece into two large squares.To fit an average sized cat, both squares should be about 19-3/4 inches (50 cm) on all sides.,##STEP##Press a 3/4-inch (2-cm) hem around both squares.,##STEP##Cut a separate square of batting.,##STEP##Pin the batting to one fleece square.,##STEP##Cut four 12-inch (30-cm) lengths of webbing.,##STEP##Melt the raw edges of the webbing.,##STEP##Pin the webbing straps to each corner of one fleece square.,##STEP##Form loops with the webbing.,##STEP##Baste the loops to the fabric.,##STEP##Pin together the two fleece squares.,##STEP##Sew around most of the perimeter of the fabric.,##STEP##Turn the fleece right-side out.,##STEP##Stitch the final opening closed.,##STEP##Sew a parallel row of zigzag stitches around the entire perimeter.Starting 1/2 inch (1.25 cm) in from the edge, sew a line of zigzag stitches around all four sides of the perimeter, overlapping the start and end stitches to keep them secure.,##STEP##Attach hooks to each loop.,##STEP##Hang the hammock from the hooks.,##STEP##Introduce your cat to the hammock.

title: How to Entertain Your Cat With a Cat Toy Mouse1
headline: ##STEP##Start by tying a string to the mouses head or body.,##STEP##Throw the cat mouse onto the floor, somewhere in front of your cat, yet not too close!##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##If your cat jumps in surprise, as most cats will do, pull the cat toy mouse away from her.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Pull a little bit, and then stop.,##STEP##Once your cat steps closer, simply pull the cat mouse toy away from her again!##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Now you've started a game and the more you'll pull away, the more your cat will chase after the cat mouse toy.##STEP####STEP##

title: How to Entertain Your Cat With a Cat Toy Mouse2
headline: ##STEP##The trick to avoid your cat getting bored from one cat mouse toy for cats, is by occasionally swapping the cat mice with new, exciting cat mice!##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##This means, that if you buy a few cat toy mice, you can let your cat play with one cat mouse, till she gets bored and then give her a different cat mouse to play with.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##The result is that, your cat will be happy to play with the cat mice and won't get bored.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##What kind of Cat Toy Mice should you choose for your cat?##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##The best thing to do at first, is to choose a couple of cat mice for your cat.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Once you've gotten the first couple of cat mice, you will be able to see which of the cat toy mice your cat likes best!##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##After that, it will be easy to determine which cat toy mouse to get for your cat.##STEP####STEP##

title: How to Find Some Toys for Your Cats
headline: ##STEP##Find out how many categories of toys the pet shop really has.,##STEP##Pay close attention to the price, many cat toys are rather expensive, especially if they're from a fancy company.,##STEP##Check your house for other things that can make good cat toys, also check out other shops, bendy straws from the supermarket will entertain many cats, same goes for crumpled up pieces of paper and plastic bags.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Play with the cat, don't be upset if the cat doesn't like some toys, this is why you got cheap stuff to find out what he likes.,##STEP##Once you know which category of toys your cat likes buy different kinds of toys from these categories.,##STEP##Keep track of what kind of toys your cat likes and use this to figure out what makes him like these toys.,##STEP##Impress your cat with your knowledge of what he likes, if you feel confident enough you can start spending a little more money on the toys you know he will love.,##STEP##Make the actual top ten once you have the final selection of toys.

title: How to Build a Portable Cat's Tree House
headline: ##STEP##Select a section of tree trunk to begin with.,##STEP##Cut down your tree and trim it to length, then trim any sharp branches and limbs as close to the trunk as possible.,##STEP##Make a straight, square cut on the base of your trunk.,##STEP##Square the ends of the trunk (or trunks, if the tree has a fork) with a saw so platforms will sit level on them.,##STEP##Build a solid base for your trunk to sit on.,##STEP##Mount the trunk on your base with large wood screws or lag bolts.,##STEP##Fasten deck boards on the top of the tree truck with one edge flush with the trunk to allow your cat to access the deck.,##STEP##Set a small house, or a basket or other feature on the deck for the cat to lay in.,##STEP##Attach strips of carpet or wind a small rope around the trunk of the tree house to give your cat something to grip easily when climbing the contraption.,##STEP##Stain, paint, or leave the wood in its natural condition if desired.

title: How to Build a Cat Climber
headline: ##STEP##Cut one of the 4x4” posts in half using a handsaw.,##STEP##Cut a piece of carpet large enough to cover all, but about a foot of each 4X4” post.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Use a staple gun and staple the carpet tightly to each post by placing a staple every inch along one side of the post.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Measure and cut out a piece of carpet to cover the top and sides of the 2x3 sheet of thick wood.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Staple this piece of carpet to the thick wood.,##STEP##Cut two 1.5x1.5” pieces out of the thin sheet of wood.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Cut four strips about 3x1.5” from the left over section of the thin sheet of wood.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Measure and cut out pieces of carpet to cover each of the pieces from Steps 6 and 7.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Staple these pieces of carpet and wood together.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Hammer the carpeted 3x1.5” pieces to one of the carpeted 1.5x1.5" pieces around the edges to form an open box.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Wrap the rope around the sections of the wood posts that do not have carpet on them.,##STEP##Measure and cut two pieces of carpet for the PVC pipe.,##STEP##Glue the carpet onto the PVC pipe and let it stand for 30 minutes-1 hour.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Nail the posts to the base by nailing from the bottom of the base.,##STEP##Screw the PVC pipe in between the two posts using a drill.,##STEP##Nail the 1.5x1.5" with the 3x1.5" pieces on the edges to the posts.,##STEP##Nail the flat carpeted 1.5x1.5" wood on top of the taller post.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Once you make sure the structure is sturdy, add toys that can hang from it for more appeal to your cat!##STEP####STEP##

title: How to Bring Out Your Cat's Inner Gamer on the iPad
headline: ##STEP##Before starting, check the condition of your cat's paws.,##STEP##Let your cat sit next to or with you as you use the iPad.,##STEP##Allow her to investigate further by sniffing, walking over, sitting on and pawing at the iPad.,##STEP##If your cat shows an interest in the iPad, let her watch and even paw moving items such as a movie, music program or a video.,##STEP##Download an app made just for cats.,##STEP##Stay with your cat as she plays on the iPad.,##STEP##Try to tempt your cat away from the iPad with an "ordinary" toy.,##STEP##Take photos or videos of your cat playing on the iPad.,##STEP##Put the iPad away safely after play.

title: How to Catch a Goat
headline: ##STEP##Bring some grain.,##STEP##Approach slowly from an angle where the goat can see you and the grain bucket.,##STEP##Offer the feed.,##STEP##To pin against a wall, place one knee in front of the shoulder blade and the other knee behind the ribs and lean into it.,##STEP##Once caught, the goat should be tethered to a secure object by a chain or strong rope.

title: How to Band a Goat
headline: ##STEP##Purchase an elastrator from a farm and ranch supply store.,##STEP##Buy castration bands.,##STEP##Ask your local veterinarian to provide pain reliever and tetanus anti-toxin.,##STEP##Plan to castrate your kid within 8 weeks of birth.,##STEP##Administer a dose of adult aspirin or a shot of Banamine a half hour before you do the procedure.,##STEP##Give a 1 cc shot of tetanus anti-toxin to prevent tetanus.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Soak your castration band in alcohol for 5 minutes before placing it in the elastrator.##STEP####STEP##,##STEP##Ask a friend to help you by holding the kid down.,##STEP##Attach the rubber band to the front prongs of the elastrator.,##STEP##Insert the scrotum and testis inside the rubber band.,##STEP##Ensure that both testes are inside the band before you release the elastrator.,##STEP##Release the grip on the elastrator slowly.,##STEP##Cut the band away right after banding, if you believe it has not been done right.,##STEP##Check the kid daily for signs of infection.,##STEP##Ensure the scrotum is starting to fall off.
